issues.title: [Bug] Update documentation and examples on how to use typedSearchAttributes
issues.author: huksley
issues.summary: Documentation for typedSearchAttributes is incomplete and lacks concrete examples for migrating from the deprecated searchAttributes API in WorkflowOptions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add workflow API to create independent deterministic pseudo-number sequence
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to add workflow API for creating independent deterministic PRNG sequences to prevent NDEs when plugins and workflow code both use Math.random() or uuid4(), which can disrupt the global PRNG sequence during replay.

issues.title: [Bug] AI-SDK - Missing descriptions of tools, fields and wrong input parameter definitions
issues.author: maxi1555
issues.summary: MCP tools passed to the AI-SDK are missing descriptions and have incorrect input parameter definitions. The tool descriptions are being dropped, and nested jsonSchema structures are causing parsing failures in the model.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose activityType counts in WorkerInfo
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Request to expose per-activity-type counts in WorkerInfo alongside existing aggregate metrics like numInFlightActivities. This would help developers debug worker task slot exhaustion by identifying which activity types are consuming resources.

issues.title: Allow logging in queries and update validators
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Logging is currently suppressed during queries and update validators because `isReplaying()` returns true. This feature request seeks to allow logging in these live read operations, bringing TypeScript SDK in line with other SDKs.

issues.title: [Bug] operatorService not accessible on `ConnectionLike`
issues.author: vaibhavscale
issues.summary: The `operatorService` is not accessible on the `ConnectionLike` interface, requiring users to cast the connection to `Connection` type to access operator functionality like listing search attributes.

issues.title: [Bug] AI-SDK - callToolActivity
issues.author: maxi1555
issues.summary: MCP Client connection closes before tool execution completes in callToolActivity. The function needs to await the tool.execute() call instead of returning the promise directly, causing the connection to close prematurely.

issues.title: ai-sdk - call tool activity
issues.author: maxi1555
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK is unable to call tools when using Google as provider with MCP server due to a missing `clientArgs` property on the args object. The code references `args.clientArgs` which does not exist, causing the tool calling functionality to fail.

issues.title: Environment Configuration does not read the correct file path on macOS
issues.author: pvsone
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK is not reading the default environment configuration TOML file from the correct macOS path ($HOME/Library/Application Support/temporalio/temporal.toml), causing configuration loading to fail.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Per-Worker Logger
issues.author: TastyPi
issues.summary: Feature request to allow Logger configuration at the Worker level instead of globally via Runtime.install, enabling different logger instances for each Worker in multi-Worker test scenarios for isolation and per-test behavior control.

issues.title: [Bug] Signal caused `condition` to fail with `CancelledFailure` on `1.14.0`
issues.author: justinadkins
issues.summary: After upgrading to TypeScript SDK 1.14.0, workflows using signals with `condition` are failing with phantom `CancelledFailure` errors. The issue appears to be a race condition introduced in 1.14.0, as downgrading to 1.13.1/1.13.2 resolves the problem and the same code works on the earlier version.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update AI SDK integration to v6
issues.author: tconley1428
issues.summary: Feature request to update the TypeScript SDK's AI SDK integration to support v6, as per Vercel's AI SDK 6 release.

issues.title: [Feature Request] importing workflow into activity dependency causes “gRPC failed to connect before the deadline” error
issues.author: deepika-awasthi
issues.summary: Feature request to improve error messages when workflow code is imported into activity dependencies or when activities and workflows are mixed in ways that violate sandbox assumptions. Current error message 'Failed to connect before the deadline' is misleading and sends developers down the wrong debugging path.

issues.title: [Bug] Performance regression from 1.13.1 -> 1.13.2
issues.author: mnahkies
issues.summary: Performance regression from SDK version 1.13.1 to 1.13.2 causes significant CPU degradation in worker processing despite no obvious changes in the release. A comment suggests a lazy-loaded module added in 1.13.2 may be responsible.

issues.title: [Bug] High CPU usage with OTel instrumentation when updating to v1.13.x
issues.author: daniellockyer
issues.summary: After upgrading from v1.11.8 to v1.13.2, OpenTelemetry instrumentation causes excessive CPU usage (up to 100%), which disappears when OTel is disabled. The issue appears related to changes between these versions, possibly involving the reusev8context option or lazy-loaded modules.

issues.title: [Bug] unable to import reflect-metadata within workflow bundle
issues.author: hmvien
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK's `reuseV8Context` feature freezes the global Reflect object, preventing reflect-metadata from patching it with its helpers. This breaks class-based workflows using Inversify decorators, which worked in SDK 1.11.8 but fails in later versions.

issues.title: [Bug] Cannot build `@temporalio/core-bridge` rust from source
issues.author: stathis-alexander
issues.summary: The @temporalio/core-bridge package cannot be built from source in Alpine Linux because bridge-macros files were refactored into a separate top-level folder but were not included in the package.json files list after version 0.12.0.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Correct docs for OtelCollectorExporter
issues.author: clintonb
issues.summary: The docstring for OtelCollectorExporter's url parameter incorrectly states that OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT environment variable will override the provided value, but no such code exists. This documentation is confusing and should be removed.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support non-workflow activities
issues.author: maciejdudko
issues.summary: Feature request to enable executing activities outside of workflow context. The SDK must support new server APIs for starting, managing, and retrieving results of standalone activities, and workers must be able to run activities without being part of a workflow.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Implement OTel interceptors v1 as Plugin
issues.author: chris-olszewski
issues.summary: Feature request to simplify OpenTelemetry interceptor setup in TypeScript SDK by implementing it as a Plugin, allowing users to initialize OTEL with a single plugin object instead of manual configuration.

issues.title: Default maxCachedWorkflows calculation doesn't account for VM isolate memory being outside V8 heap
issues.author: alonp99
issues.summary: The default maxCachedWorkflows calculation uses V8 heap memory limits but doesn't account for the fact that workflow VM isolates allocate native memory outside the heap, causing unexpected OOM errors in containerized environments where heap limits are set high relative to container limits.

issues.title: [Bug] `WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError` should contain `runId` if provided by server
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK's WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError does not include the runId when the server provides it, even though the SDK already has the capability to extract this information from protobuf-encoded error details.

issues.title: [Bug] Worker crashes with "async hook stack has become corrupted" when Prometheus metrics enabled under high concurrency
issues.author: tshtark
issues.summary: Worker crashes with 'async hook stack has become corrupted' error when Prometheus metrics are enabled under high concurrency (100+ concurrent tasks). The crash occurs in Node.js worker threads and causes continuous pod restarts in production Kubernetes deployments.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow overriding of the Worker Deployment Version when invoking a Child Workflow
issues.author: chris-olszewski
issues.summary: Feature request to allow overriding the Worker Deployment Version when invoking a Child Workflow, similar to the capability available when creating a Workflow from a client. This enables pre-deployment testing scenarios.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Sticky Sessions Support in TypeScript SDK
issues.author: jinvillaz
issues.summary: Feature request to add native sticky sessions support to the TypeScript SDK to ensure all tasks of a workflow execute on the same worker, enabling workflows with local state. Closed as duplicate of temporalio/features#562 with indication that sessions will be redesigned across all SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Enable Worker Heartbeating
issues.author: yuandrew
issues.summary: Feature request to enable worker heartbeating in the TypeScript SDK by allowing users to specify the worker heartbeat interval when initializing Core Runtime. This capability is already implemented in Core but needs to be exposed to users.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide a way to distinguish error types in logs from TypeScript SDK (errors lose type info across Worker <-> Workflow)
issues.author: antmendoza
issues.summary: Users cannot distinguish error types in TypeScript SDK logs because errors lose type information when passed between Worker and Workflow boundaries, preventing appropriate log level assignment and error categorization.

issues.title: [Bug] Changes in type inference of activity return type in SDK 1.12.2
issues.author: rd-akind
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK 1.12.2 introduced a regression in type inference for activity return types when using proxyActivities, causing 'implicitly has type any' errors in code that previously compiled successfully. The issue is linked to changes in the ActivityInterfaceFor type definition in PR #1657.

issues.title: [Bug] Replay workflow history fails with nondeterminism error, child workflow ids do not match
issues.author: mishabruml
issues.summary: Workflow history replay fails with a nondeterminism error when child workflows are present, even though the child workflow IDs are generated fresh from the history. The error indicates a mismatch between scheduled event IDs and command IDs for child workflows during replay.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow querying the port/address via TestWorkflowEnvironment
issues.author: hanikesn
issues.summary: Feature request to allow querying the port and address from TestWorkflowEnvironment when using a random free port with createLocal(), enabling manual client creation without needing to pass the address separately to the application.

issues.title: [Bug] Remove peer dependencies from @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry
issues.author: TastyPi
issues.summary: The @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry package has peer dependencies on @temporalio/activity, @temporalio/common, @temporalio/worker, and @temporalio/workflow, causing Yarn warnings when consuming only @temporalio/client. The fix is to mark these peer dependencies as optional.

issues.title: `WorkflowIdReusePolicy.TERMINATE_IF_RUNNING` deprecated or not?
issues.author: cliaer
issues.summary: WorkflowIdReusePolicy.TERMINATE_IF_RUNNING is marked as deprecated in SDK code but still documented as valid in official Temporal.io docs, causing confusion. User needs clarification on whether it's safe to use, especially for child workflows that need to reset with their parent.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ensure tests exist to confirm custom slot supplier slot info has proper fields
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add tests verifying that custom slot supplier implementations properly populate all required slot info fields in the TypeScript SDK.

issues.title: [Bug] `@temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry` OTEL bypasses a required SDK component
issues.author: sdedovic
issues.summary: The @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry library bypasses the required OTEL SpanProcessor, passing spans directly to SpanExporter, which causes errors when accessing resource attributes before they're awaited. The fix requires accepting a SpanProcessor instead of a SpanExporter and calling onEnd() instead of directly exporting.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ensure gRPC binary metadata headers are supported
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to support gRPC binary metadata headers in the TypeScript SDK's native connection. Currently needs to accept Uint8Array as metadata values and transmit them as binary to Tonic for -bin suffixed keys.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reclassify Benign Application errors in OpenTelemetry
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Feature request to reclassify benign application errors in OpenTelemetry spans to prevent noise in monitoring systems. This mirrors a similar request from the Python SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support for creating v7 UUIDs from within Workflow Tasks
issues.author: roberto-retool
issues.summary: Request to add support for generating UUIDv7 in workflow tasks, similar to the existing uuid4() function. Users need this for better indexing and sorting semantics, but cannot use the npm uuid package due to its crypto module dependency.

issues.title: [Bug] error: TypeError: (0 , ms_1.default) is not a function
issues.author: anh-rivergon
issues.summary: TypeError: (0 , ms_1.default) is not a function error when starting a worker due to incompatible ms package version 3.0.0-canary.1. The issue was resolved by using a proper canary release or clearing npm cache.

issues.title: extractSourceMap takes a huge amount of RAM on boot
issues.author: NikhilVerma
issues.summary: Source map parsing during worker initialization consumes excessive RAM (2GB+), particularly when running multiple workers on a single machine. The issue is caused by the extractSourceMap function loading entire source maps into memory without optimization.

issues.title: [Bug] Network error while sending worker heartbeat after updating to 1.12.2
issues.author: HalfdanJ
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK v1.12.2 introduces a regression where worker heartbeats fail with permission denied errors when connecting to Temporal Cloud with API keys, causing workers to crash in production despite working in local dev environments.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Plugin support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request for plugin support in the TypeScript SDK to enable extensibility and custom integrations, referencing a cross-SDK features discussion.

issues.title: [Bug] Hostname is overly restrictive
issues.author: Dispersia
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK hostname validation is overly restrictive and prevents connecting to Temporal instances hosted behind reverse proxies at subpaths. The validation only allows hostname or hostname:port format, rejecting paths like /temporal.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Temporal integration for `@openai/agents`
issues.author: corelix
issues.summary: Request for an official Temporal integration with the OpenAI Agents SDK for JavaScript/TypeScript, similar to the existing Python SDK integration. This would enable durable state persistence, fault recovery, observability, and scalable agent execution within Temporal workflows.

issues.title: [Bug] Calling a Workflow with Worker Versioning and PINNED behavior in versionOverrides fails in Temporal Server >=1.28.0
issues.author: jbrody-nexxa
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK client sends versioning override data in a format incompatible with Temporal Server 1.28.0+, which expects either the new v0.32 structure with pinned override behavior or the deprecated v0.31 structure, but not both mixed together. This causes workflow startup to fail with a validation error.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add Activity support for Worker Versioning
issues.author: jbrody-nexxa
issues.summary: Feature request to add Activity support for Worker Versioning, allowing Workflows to specify which version of an Activity to use. Currently, teams must work around this limitation by encoding Activity version into task queue names despite using Worker Versioning for both Workflows and Activities.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow logs not propagated unless telemetryOptions.logging.filter is DEBUG or TRACE
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Workflow application logs are not displayed unless the telemetry logging filter is set to DEBUG or TRACE, contrary to expected behavior where INFO level logs should appear with an INFO filter setting.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow task not found after SDK upgrade
issues.author: btravers
issues.summary: After upgrading from SDK v1.11.8 to v1.12.1, users experience 'Workflow task not found' errors on long-running workflows. The underlying cause appears to be performance degradation preventing workers from completing tasks within the 10-second timeout window.

issues.title: Cannot suppress worker state logs in test environment
issues.author: jtomaszewski
issues.summary: Worker state logs in the TypeScript SDK cannot be suppressed in test environments, cluttering test output with verbose INFO-level messages. The issue was resolved by using Runtime.install() with DefaultLogger configured to a higher log level.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add Summary to LocalActivityOptions
issues.author: yuandrew
issues.summary: Request to add a Summary field to LocalActivityOptions in the TypeScript SDK, similar to what exists in the features repository. This would allow developers to provide descriptive information about local activities.

issues.title: [Bug] NDE replaying nested promises
issues.author: antmendoza
issues.summary: NDE (nondeterminism error) occurs during workflow replay when using nested Promise.all() with multiple activities. The activity execution order differs between initial execution and replay, causing a 'No command scheduled' error.

issues.title: Why do you use this
issues.author: nichechristie
issues.summary: User asks why a specific implementation approach is used in worker-options.ts without providing context. The maintainer suggests reviewing the worker shutdown documentation.

issues.title: [Bug] webpackConfigHook doesn't seem to suppress all webpack output
issues.author: DatGuyJonathan
issues.summary: The webpackConfigHook doesn't suppress all webpack output despite setting config.stats to 'none'. Webpack logging is still being printed even when users try to minimize logs through bundlerOptions configuration.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `ActivityContext.workerShuttingDown`
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to add `workerShuttingDown` promise and `workerShuttingDownSignal` abort signal to ActivityContext in TypeScript SDK, matching functionality available in other Temporal SDKs (Go, Python, .NET) to detect worker shutdown before grace period expiration.

issues.title: [Bug] opentelemetry traceState is handled properly in  makeWorkflowExporter
issues.author: safareli
issues.summary: When using OpenTelemetry with workflow tracing, traceState objects lose their class context during serialization between the workflow isolate and main thread, causing a TypeError when the OTLP exporter tries to call the missing serialize() method.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Mask/sanitize client sensitive data references
issues.author: ssukienn
issues.summary: Feature request to mask or sanitize sensitive data in SDK objects to prevent accidental exposure of API keys and authentication credentials when objects are serialized or logged. Proposes implementing custom serialization behaviors and data structure redesigns to mitigate critical security vulnerabilities.

issues.title: [Bug] `RetryPolicy.maximumAttempt === 0` throws, while it is documented as a valid value for "unlimited"
issues.author: jsamr
issues.summary: RetryPolicy.maximumAttempts === 0 throws an error, but documentation states that 0 should be a valid value for unlimited retries. The TypeScript SDK implementation contradicts the official Temporal documentation regarding this configuration.

issues.title: [Bug] Unable to run tests
issues.author: ksapchuk
issues.summary: Tests fail to start the Temporal test server on Apple M3 Pro with a CPU features error after a change in the test server build process. The issue was caused by compiler optimizations in GraalVM that depend on AMD64 CPU features not emulated by Rosetta on ARM-based Macs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Environment Configuration
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Feature request to implement environment configuration for the TypeScript SDK, following the pattern defined in the external client configuration proposal for all SDKs.

issues.title: Condition callback function is not support Promise return in type
issues.author: liho00
issues.summary: User reported that the `condition()` function's callback doesn't accept async functions returning Promise<boolean>, even though the Promise return type seems implied by the function signature.

issues.title: [Bug] TypeError: Failed to initialize workflow of type 'sayHello': no such function is exported by the workflow bundle
issues.author: liho00
issues.summary: Workflow function not found in bundle when using Temporal worker with NestJS. The issue occurs when bundling workflows, with the bundled workflow exports not being properly recognized by importWorkflows(), particularly when combining multiple workflow files and using Bluebird's map() function.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Include error details on every errors thrown from Client API
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to include decoded gRPC error details on all errors thrown from the Client API, not just specific high-level error classes. This would help users diagnose operational issues by providing access to server-provided error metadata, though it requires solving challenges around type checking, error serialization, and recursive protobuf decoding.

issues.title: [Bug] Error thrown from Client's Update-with-Start doesn't show proper message
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: When Update-with-Start API errors occur, the error message shown to users displays a generic 'MultiOperation could not be executed' text instead of the actual detailed error message that is available in the error object. This makes debugging difficult for users who rely on standard error printing.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Lazily load webpack
issues.author: arlyon
issues.summary: Feature request to lazily load webpack in the TypeScript SDK worker package to reduce bundle size and enable stripping webpack from containers. The user has demonstrated a working patch that uses dynamic require for the bundler module instead of eager loading.

issues.title: [Bug] Protobuf Payload Converter is broken after upgrading to protobufjs 7.5.2
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Protobuf Payload Converter is broken after upgrading protobufjs to 7.5.2 due to a new `_fullyQualifiedObjects` property that conflicts with SDK's custom Protobuf Root patching logic.

issues.title: [TypeScript] Worker Versioning high level client
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Create a high-level client for control plane operations concerning worker deployments in the TypeScript SDK, following the pattern established in the Go SDK.

issues.title: If a serializable value is provided as a SearchAttribute, serialize it instead of throwing the error: "SearchAttribute values must arrays of strings, numbers, booleans, or Dates. The value * at index 0 is of type object"
issues.author: JCMais
issues.summary: SearchAttribute validation should call toJSON() on serializable objects before rejecting them. This enables passing objects like MongoDB ObjectIds that have a toJSON method as search attributes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Pass webpack obj as the second parameter when calling webpackConfigHook
issues.author: JCMais
issues.summary: Feature request to pass webpack object as second parameter to webpackConfigHook so users can access webpack plugins like DefinePlugin without importing webpack separately, avoiding potential version mismatches.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Better type inference for `MockActivityEnvironment.run`
issues.author: TastyPi
issues.summary: The `MockActivityEnvironment.run` method infers return type as `unknown` instead of the actual function's return type, breaking type safety in strict TypeScript mode. A proposed solution uses better generic type constraints to properly infer the return type.

issues.title: [Bug] MockActivityEnvironment's activityInfo().workflowExecution.runId is not a UUID
issues.author: TastyPi
issues.summary: MockActivityEnvironment generates non-UUID run IDs for activityInfo().workflowExecution.runId, breaking UUID-based operations that work correctly in real Temporal instances.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Complete work on supporting `Client` over `NativeConnection`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Complete the implementation of Client over NativeConnection by adding OperatorService and HealthService support, AbortSignal handling, missing Core Client options, and ensuring test coverage for both connection types. This feature is required for supporting Eager Workflow Start.

issues.title: [Bug] Test suite timeout on first run
issues.author: NavaraKoen
issues.summary: Test suite times out on first run when SDK download takes longer than test framework timeout (2s default), with no informational message about the download. On slow/proxied connections, the download can fail or get corrupted, leaving a confusing temp file and timeout error.

issues.title: [Bug] @temporalio/worker: NativeConnection fails with NativeCertsNotFound on Temporal Cloud connection using API Key
issues.author: harukitosa
issues.summary: NativeConnection fails to establish TLS connections to Temporal Cloud due to missing root CA certificates, while the client Connection works properly with the same configuration. The error occurs during the TLS handshake phase before API key authentication.

issues.title: [Feature Request] executeChild to use passed headers
issues.author: notusertelken
issues.summary: Feature request to allow executeChild to accept and propagate headers through its options argument. Currently, headers are hardcoded to empty object, preventing context propagation from parent to child workflows when using executeChild, while code client workflows can propagate context via headers and interceptors.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Put `temporal-namespace` header on all requests from pure JS client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Pure JS client needs a gRPC interceptor that adds a `temporal-namespace` header to all requests when a namespace field is present in the request object. This feature also requires adding a CI test for cloud integration.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Otel exporter error handling
issues.author: cirias
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry exporter errors are silently ignored by the Temporal SDK, making it difficult to debug exporter misconfigurations. The feature request proposes adding an optional callback parameter to `makeWorkflowExporter` to propagate these errors to users.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ability to record markers from workflow
issues.author: Inviz
issues.summary: User requests the ability to record markers from workflows to capture intermediate state in the event history without causing workflow activations. The feature is declined by maintainers as markers are low-level primitives not intended for direct SDK usage.

issues.title: [typescript] SDK support for activity reset
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request to add SDK support for activity reset functionality in TypeScript SDK, following the implementation in other SDKs as defined in the features repository.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Change get static summary/details on workflow in client to be lazy
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to change eager decoding of static workflow summary/details to lazy loading in the TypeScript client. Currently these are decoded immediately; the request is to defer decoding until the data is actually requested.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Warn when the server-provided task start time is fairly different than time SDK begins processing the task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to warn developers when the server-provided task start time differs significantly from when the SDK begins processing the task. This would help identify timing discrepancies in task execution.

issues.title: [Bug] Temporal local env cannot be connected in unit tests
issues.author: eyal-ringwald-orchid
issues.summary: Unit tests using TestWorkflowEnvironment.createLocal() fail intermittently with connection timeouts when running multiple test suites together, causing the NativeConnection.connect() call to time out. The issue appears to be resource-related and only manifests when running 10+ test suites sequentially.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow cancel polling of `client.result()` (via timeout / AbortSignal) to stop leak
issues.author: alex-statsig
issues.summary: Feature request for adding AbortSignal or timeout support to client.result() to allow cancellation of result polling and prevent resource leaks. The user wanted to wait briefly for workflow completion without blocking indefinitely.

issues.title: [Bug] TLS server name override not respected
issues.author: dan8f
issues.summary: TLS server name override setting in client connection is being overridden by the address parameter due to a grpc-js library issue. The problem was resolved by updating the @grpc/grpc-js dependency to version 1.13.4 or higher.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Show retry policy on activity info
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to display retry policy information on the ActivityInfo object, enabling activities to access their configured retry settings at runtime.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add missing hooks on OTel interceptors
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: The OpenTelemetry interceptor lacks support for tracing propagation on inbound update requests. A comprehensive review is needed to identify and implement any other missing hooks in the interceptor.

issues.title: [Bug] Upgrading OTel Interceptor to 1.11.5+ breaks signal-with-start and may cause NDE
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Upgrading to OTel Interceptor 1.11.5+ changes execution order of workflow code, causing signal handlers to execute out of order compared to earlier versions and potentially causing non-determinism errors during replay of older workflows.

issues.title: Vulnerability GHSA-4p46-pwfr-66x6 - ring, GHSA-2gh3-rmm4-6rq5 - protobuf
issues.author: msaffitz
issues.summary: Two medium severity vulnerabilities (GHSA-4p46-pwfr-66x6 in ring and GHSA-2gh3-rmm4-6rq5 in protobuf) were discovered in Cargo dependencies. These security issues have been resolved in version 1.11.8 and main branch.

issues.title: [Feature Request] support AggregateError
issues.author: safareli
issues.summary: Feature request to support AggregateError with multiple child errors. Currently the SDK only supports single error causes, but AggregateError allows storing multiple errors with nested causes, which should be extracted and stored or included in stack traces.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add support for batched result retrieval executions
issues.author: akaNightmare
issues.summary: User requests a batched result retrieval method for workflow executions to improve performance when processing large numbers of results. Currently, sequential retrieval of 1000 executions takes ~1 minute, making 1M executions infeasible (~1000 minutes).

issues.title: [Feature Request] Apply application failure logging and metrics behaviour according to ApplicationErrorCategory
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Feature request to implement application failure logging and metrics behavior according to ApplicationErrorCategory in the TypeScript SDK. This requires core SDK changes to handle metrics, with the TypeScript SDK needing to apply corresponding logging behavior.

issues.title: [Bug] common package not importing @types/ms
issues.author: cosn
issues.summary: The `common` package imports the `ms` library but doesn't include its type definitions (@types/ms), causing type validation issues for Duration properties and breaking temporal usage when the package is used as a transitive dependency without explicit type assertions.

issues.title: Heartbeating activities should be interrupted when the activities are paused.
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Activities should be interrupted when they are paused to prevent unnecessary heartbeating. This follows the pattern described in temporalio/features#602.

issues.title: [Bug] Can't use structuredClone in workflow code
issues.author: pn1k
issues.summary: The structuredClone() function is not available in workflow code when using the TypeScript SDK, preventing users from copying objects. While simple injection is possible, it causes prototype issues where instanceof checks fail for cloned objects.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Serialization context for codecs and converters
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add serialization context support for codecs and converters in TypeScript SDK, with specific requirements for Nexus integration. References design discussion in the features repository.

issues.title: [Bug] RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED error while describing workflow schedule
issues.author: jhecking
issues.summary: RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED error occurs when describing a schedule that has been running for a while, causing the schedule workflow's consistent query buffer to fill up. The issue appears to be server-side rather than SDK-related.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support New Worker Versioning API
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Add support for the new Worker Versioning API in TypeScript SDK by implementing annotations for workflows. This feature aligns the TS SDK with Go SDK implementations as defined in the design specification.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add support for opentelemetry v2
issues.author: karlismelderis-mckinsey
issues.summary: Feature request to support OpenTelemetry v2 and newer library versions (0.200.0+). The SDK currently only supports OTel v1, and upgrading would be a breaking change for existing users.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow type is incorrectly deduced when using `bind` on workflow function
issues.author: jean-pruliere
issues.summary: When a workflow function is bound to an instance using `.bind()`, the function's name property becomes `bound <name>`, causing the workflow type to be incorrectly deduced as `bound example` instead of `example`. This mismatch prevents workers from executing the workflow since they register with the original function name.

issues.title: Dependency Vulnerability: Zip library
issues.author: jmiralles
issues.summary: Dependency vulnerability in zip library (CVE-2025-29787) used for extracting ephemeral server binaries in test environments. While the actual risk is low due to the library's limited usage context and trusted source downloads, the dependency was updated to version 2.3.0 to resolve compliance and audit concerns.

issues.title: [Bug] Broken Documentation Link
issues.author: sdedovic
issues.summary: Documentation link in WorkerOptions.workflowBundle docstring is broken and points to non-existent page. User cannot find the referenced production deployment documentation.

issues.title: [Bug] Throw on usage of Workflow APIs that modify state from non-replayable context
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Workflow APIs that modify state (like commands, random generation, and signal handlers) should throw an error when invoked from read-only contexts such as query handlers and update validation handlers, preventing runtime failures and NDE errors.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add summary to Nexus operation
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to add a summary field to Nexus operations, referenced from the cross-repository features issue tracker.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Initial Nexus implementation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request for implementing Nexus support in the TypeScript SDK alongside the generic Nexus TypeScript SDK. The team is actively working on this integration with ongoing work tracked in the nexus-rpc/sdk-typescript repository.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Rehydrate TypedSearchAttributes for sinks or provide WorkflowInfo variant
issues.author: THardy98
issues.summary: Feature request to rehydrate TypedSearchAttributes for sinks or provide a WorkflowInfo variant, following discussion in issue #1612 about improving type safety for search attributes in workflow context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Custom metric bucket sizes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose histogram bucket overrides for custom metric bucket sizes in the TypeScript SDK, as implemented in sdk-core.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose root workflow execution
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose root workflow execution context in the TypeScript SDK, dependent on core SDK and features implementation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add error message to OpenTelemetry span setStatus
issues.author: xavierroma
issues.summary: Feature request to enhance OpenTelemetry span status to include error messages in addition to error codes. Currently, error spans only show the error code without the actual error message, making troubleshooting in observability tools difficult.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Built-in query responses should use "RawValue"
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to ensure built-in query responses use RawValue when feature #1629 is completed. This is part of implementing consistent query response handling across the TypeScript SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support "RawValue" non-converted values
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to implement a 'RawValue' payload wrapper that allows developers to bypass payload converters and send unconverted values directly through the Temporal SDK.

issues.title: Child Workflows not Respecting WorkflowIdConflictPolicy.USE_EXISTING
issues.author: blorgon1
issues.summary: Child workflows are not respecting the WorkflowIdConflictPolicy.USE_EXISTING setting and throw WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError when attempting to start a child workflow with an existing ID. The server doesn't support conflict policies for child workflows, making this SDK exposure incorrect.

issues.title: Expose Workflow cancel cause/reason
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Expose the cancel cause/reason from WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes when workflows receive cancellations. Additionally allow users to provide and receive this cancel cause when issuing cancellations from clients or commands.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Include musl-based shared library in package
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to include musl-based shared library in the TypeScript SDK package for better compatibility with musl-based Linux distributions (Alpine Linux containers).

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support Priority Annotations
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Feature request to add support for attaching priority annotations to workflows and activities in the TypeScript SDK. Details referenced in the cross-SDK features issue #593.

issues.title: [Bug] on using bun not able to connect temporal
issues.author: satya-nected
issues.summary: User reports that Temporal TypeScript SDK worker cannot connect when running on Bun runtime - the connection hangs and doesn't respond. SDK maintainers clarified that Bun is not officially supported due to differences in N-API error handling between Bun and Node.js.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Custom Activity Function Name in UI
issues.author: semics-tech
issues.summary: User requests the ability to assign custom names to activities in the Temporal UI to differentiate between multiple executions of the same function with different parameters. Currently activities only show the function name, requiring users to click each activity to see parameters.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add memoization support to the`patched()` API
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Add memoization support to the patched() API with a new memoized argument, maintaining backward compatibility while deprecating non-memoized signatures. Delegate the patched logic handling to Core.

issues.title: [Bug] Cannot use Temporal with NextJS 15 because workflowTypes come from function names
issues.author: rclmenezes
issues.summary: Temporal TypeScript SDK relies on function names for workflow types, which breaks in NextJS 15+ when code is minified. The function name property has no semantic guarantee in JavaScript and gets mangled by minifiers, causing workflow initialization failures.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Split worker build tool dependencies into a separate package
issues.author: pauldraper
issues.summary: User requests splitting Temporal worker build tool dependencies into a separate package because the worker package is extremely heavy (169MB for a simple Hello World app), pulling in developer tooling like webpack, swc, and webassemblyjs that should only be needed at build time, not in production.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow customization of dev server UI port
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to allow customization of the dev server UI port in the TypeScript SDK, referenced from a cross-SDK features issue.

issues.title: Vulnerability GHSA-wwq9-3cpr-mm53 - hashbrown
issues.author: moyara-allgood
issues.summary: A vulnerability in the hashbrown Rust dependency (GHSA-wwq9-3cpr-mm53) was reported in the TypeScript SDK's core-bridge. The team assessed the risk as low for Temporal's use case since hashbrown is never used in security-sensitive contexts or with user-controlled input.

issues.title: [Bug] TypeScript error TS2322: Type 'AsyncIterableIterator<any[]>' is not assignable to type 'AsyncIterable<[B]>'.
issues.author: philwhln
issues.summary: TypeScript compilation errors occur when using `client.workflow.list()` due to type mismatches in the EventEmitter-based iterator type definitions in iterators-utils.ts. The issue is caused by type incompatibilities between `AsyncIterableIterator<any[]>` and the expected `AsyncIterable<[B]>` generic types.

issues.title: result of env.run is not inferring type, returning `unknown`
issues.author: chadxz
issues.summary: The return type of env.run() in the testing framework is not being inferred from the activity, returning `unknown` instead of the expected type. A user has provided a potential fix but wants guidance on whether it would be a breaking change.

issues.title: [Feature Request] OTel metrics over HTTP
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to enable OTel metrics export over HTTP instead of the default gRPC protocol in the TypeScript SDK. Comment indicates the feature was implemented but not working correctly with HTTP URLs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Special behavior for Temporal built-in prefixes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to implement special behavior for Temporal built-in prefixes in the TypeScript SDK, as detailed in the cross-repository features issue #576.

issues.title: [Bug] First schedule action started using triggerImmediately flag does not honor the schedule's overlap policy
issues.author: jhecking
issues.summary: When creating a schedule with triggerImmediately: true, the initial run ignores the schedule's overlap policy and always uses AllowAll, causing subsequent runs to execute immediately instead of being buffered according to the configured policy.

issues.title: [Bug] Reusable VM allows context leak due to global symbol properties
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: When reusable V8 context is enabled, symbol properties on globalThis are not properly swapped between workflow executions, causing context leaks and memory issues. Libraries like Effect that store global state as symbol properties are particularly affected.

issues.title: [Bug] Tests `Retry on "RST_STREAM with code 0/2` failing since Node 22.12.0 on Windows
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Integration tests for RST_STREAM retry behavior are failing on Windows with Node v22.12.0+. The issue is related to a Node.js regression and was fixed by disabling affected tests on Windows for affected Node versions.

issues.title: [Bug] Using async functions degrades performance
issues.author: c0sx
issues.summary: Using async functions in TypeScript SDK workflows causes severe performance degradation (10-15x slower). The issue is traced to promiseHooks in vm-shared worker that capture stack traces for workflow queries, adding significant overhead to every promise.

issues.title: [Bug] mTLS NativeConnectionOptions tonic::transport::Error(Transport, NativeCertsNotFound)
issues.author: cawalch
issues.summary: mTLS connection with NativeConnectionOptions throws 'NativeCertsNotFound' error after upgrading from SDK 1.11.3 to 1.11.5. The issue stems from SDK v1.11.5 switching from rustls built-in CAs to system-native certificate verification, requiring explicit CA certificates in slim Docker images.

issues.title: [Bug] 1.11.2 workflow histories failing to replay on 1.11.5
issues.author: selbyk
issues.summary: Workflow histories created in v1.11.2 fail to replay in v1.11.5+ with nondeterminism errors about mismatched child workflow IDs. Root cause identified as breaking changes in OpenTelemetry interceptors affecting signal handling and local activity scheduling determinism.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflows getting stuck after cancellation (spurious WorkflowTaskFailed errors)
issues.author: tetrakatech
issues.summary: Workflows are sporadically getting stuck in a running state after cancellation, showing spurious WorkflowTaskFailed errors instead of completing cleanly. The issue occurs a few times per day in production, leading to infinite retries and blocking of orchestrator workflows.

issues.title: [Bug] Worker fails to start if Node option --abort-on-uncaught-exception is set
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Worker fails to start when Node.js --abort-on-uncaught-exception flag is set due to improper VM context configuration during bundle preloading for debuggers. The preload operation causes a TypeError that V8 can't properly track across execution contexts, resulting in process abort instead of graceful error handling.

issues.title: [Bug] CI build is broken due to GHA dropping support for node16-based actions
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: GitHub Actions dropped support for Node16-based actions and now enforces Node20, breaking CI builds that relied on GLIBC 2.24 Docker images for compatibility with older Linux distributions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Simplify API on interceptors
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to simplify the API on interceptors in the TypeScript SDK. The specific details are marked as TBD, with the intent to be covered by a related feature request.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Complete conversion of old style integration tests
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Complete conversion of old style integration tests to modern test framework in the TypeScript SDK. This is a refactoring effort to modernize the test suite.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update supported Node versions to 18.x to 22.x
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Update the TypeScript SDK and samples to support Node.js versions 18.x through 22.x and TypeScript 5.x to align with current platform and language standards.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose `AbortController` in Workflow sandbox
issues.author: lukeramsden
issues.summary: Request to expose AbortController in the Workflow sandbox to enable compatibility with libraries like xstate that use it internally for promise-based actor implementations.

issues.title: [Bug] Payload Converter doesn't work when running as ESM
issues.author: freshollie
issues.summary: Payload converter cannot be imported in ESM applications because the data converter helper code uses `require()` instead of dynamic imports, forcing users to write converters as CommonJS files.

issues.title: [Feature Request] allow opt-out of workflow isolation
issues.author: neelance
issues.summary: User requests an option to opt-out of workflow isolation in the TypeScript SDK. Workflow isolation has caused significant memory and performance issues in production, and the user argues that the Go SDK's approach of trusting developers to write deterministic code would be preferable to managing the complexity and subtle bugs introduced by isolation.

issues.title: [Bug] All log related to the same trace_id
issues.author: baptou12
issues.summary: All logs from activities are associated with the same trace_id from application startup instead of being correctly traced to individual workflow executions when using OpenTelemetry integration with Temporal.

issues.title: patched always true inside Signal
issues.author: ianmateusES
issues.summary: The `patched()` function always returns true inside signal handlers, causing all workflows to use the new signal flow instead of respecting version compatibility. This was a bug in SDK version 1.8.0-1.8.5 that prevented proper A/B testing of workflow changes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose classes `TextEncoder` and `TextDecoder` in Workflow sandbox
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Request to expose WHATWG TextEncoder and TextDecoder classes in the workflow sandbox to allow users to encode/decode text without delegating to activities or using polyfills.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Auto-skip time in time-skipping testing environment when waiting on update result
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to auto-skip time when waiting on update results in time-skipping testing environments, similar to how time is already auto-skipped when waiting on workflow results.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support user metadata
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for user metadata on workflows, activities, and timers in TypeScript SDK. Implement the __temporal_workflow_metadata query handler and accept optional summary/details parameters across workflow creation methods (start, signal with start, schedule, child workflows), activity creation, and timer creation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow Update Validators to be async
issues.author: mloffer
issues.summary: Feature request to support asynchronous Update Validators in TypeScript SDK. Currently validators must be synchronous, but users need async operations for complex access control checks (database queries, ACLs) before allowing updates.

issues.title: [Bug] Memory leak on the temporal worker side(OperatorSubscriber Class Objects are taking much of the memory)
issues.author: jainshivsagar
issues.summary: Memory usage in TypeScript SDK v1.9.0 grows during load testing (120MB to 300MB) and doesn't decrease after 5-10 minutes. Investigation suggests OperatorSubscriber instances (43,890 found) may be accumulating in the workflow cache without proper cleanup.

issues.title: Remove workflowsPath in favor or imports (like activities)
issues.author: marc-wilson
issues.summary: Feature request to allow direct imports of workflow functions in TypeScript SDK instead of requiring a file path (workflowsPath), similar to how activities are imported. This is particularly challenging for NX/Nest monorepos using webpack where the build output is a single file.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow lifecycle logging is misleading
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Workflow lifecycle logging messages are ambiguous and misleading, with identical messages for workflow task failures and actual workflow failures, and repeated 'Workflow started' messages during task replays, making it difficult for users to differentiate between these cases and set up proper alerting.

issues.title: [Bug] Worker keeps accepting WFT after Worker Thread terminates due to ERR_WORKER_OUT_OF_MEMORY
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Worker thread terminates due to out-of-memory error, causing the Worker to silently stop processing workflow tasks while the process remains running. The Worker should detect this condition and initiate graceful shutdown instead of continuing to accept tasks.

issues.title: [Bug] NDE while replaying Workflows in 1.11.1 with same code
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Workflows encounter a NotDeadLetterException (NDE) during replay in SDK 1.11.0 and 1.11.1 despite no code changes. The issue typically involves TimerCanceled commands or command ordering changes.

issues.title: Show update handler and ID in logging context
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request to improve logging context by including update handler and ID information in the TypeScript SDK. See temporalio/features#466 for additional context.

issues.title: UpdateWithStart SDK API
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Feature request to expose update-with-start operations via the TypeScript SDK. This capability allows workflows to be updated or created in a single operation, combining workflow execution initiation with state updates.

issues.title: [Bug] Payload converter error can crash worker
issues.author: ikonst
issues.summary: Payload converter errors when serializing incompatible objects (non-JSONifiable values, cyclic references) can crash the worker when they occur during error detail encoding in ApplicationError, unlike when they occur during activity response serialization.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update Core SDK: expect `initializeWorkflow` instead of `startWorkflow` jobs
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Core SDK renamed the `startWorkflow` activation job to `initializeWorkflow` with different ordering and expectations. The TypeScript SDK needs to update its activation handling logic to match this change.

issues.title: [Bug] RangeError: "length" is outside of buffer bounds
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Worker crashes with RangeError when using Node.js v22.7.0 due to a protobufjs buffer issue during workflow update message serialization. The error occurs in protobufjs's utf8Write and is fixed by upgrading to Node.js v22.8.0 or ensuring matching versions of all @temporalio packages.

issues.title: [Bug] Worker doesn't start in arm64 docker container
issues.author: gregkonush
issues.summary: Worker fails to start in ARM64 Docker containers due to a missing symbol (__register_atfork) in the core-bridge native module. The issue was resolved by using a non-Alpine Linux distribution (e.g., Bullseye) instead of musl-based distributions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow passing live `payloadConverter` object on Client and Activity-Worker
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to allow passing live `payloadConverter` and `failureConverter` objects directly to Client and Activity-only workers, rather than requiring file paths. For Workflow workers, propose extracting payload converters from workflow bundles.

issues.title: [Bug] @temporalio/worker with subdependency @opentelemetry/api version higher than 1.6.0 breaks
issues.author: bert-bae
issues.summary: @temporalio/worker's deep import from @opentelemetry/api's build directory breaks when @opentelemetry/api is upgraded to version 1.9.0, as the import path './build/src/trace/NoopTracer' is no longer exported. The issue was resolved by removing the dependency on NoopTracer in a later version.

issues.title: Expose activity retry options via activity Info interface
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Activity retry options are not exposed through the activity Info interface in TypeScript SDK, unlike in the Java SDK. This feature request asks to add this capability.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Native Request Batching to Prevent "received message larger than max" Errors
issues.author: dp-dandy
issues.summary: Feature request to implement automatic request batching in the TypeScript SDK to prevent gRPC message size errors when scheduling many activities. The SDK currently batches activity scheduling commands into a single request, which can exceed the 4MB gRPC limit when starting ~600 activities, causing workflow freezes and silent failures.

issues.title: [Bug] Reenable OTLP export tests
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: OTLP export integration tests for Core metrics have become noisy due to recent Core dependency updates causing grpc response errors. Tests were disabled pending a proper mock collector implementation.

issues.title: [Bug] log.error doesn't log the error
issues.author: shawnjones253
issues.summary: The log.error() method in workflow interceptors doesn't properly serialize Error objects, logging only the message and context fields while omitting all error properties like the stack trace.

issues.title: [Bug] Critical dependency: the request of a dependency is an expression
issues.author: shadiramadan
issues.summary: Next.js bundling fails with a critical dependency error when importing the Temporal client in server-side code. The error originates from data-converter-helpers.js which uses a dynamic require expression that bundlers cannot statically analyze.

issues.title: Review use of `untrackPromise` in update implementation
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Review whether `untrackPromise` is being used correctly in the update implementation. Discussion in PR #1459 raised concerns about its usage patterns.

issues.title: Workflow-init support docs
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request for documentation on workflow initialization guarantees to ensure signals and updates can safely use initialized values. Need to document that signals can arrive before the workflow method executes and provide initialization patterns.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reduce TS parsing/evaluation times
issues.author: milesj
issues.summary: TypeScript compilation times are slow due to large barrel imports in @temporalio/client and a massive 49k-line proto declaration file. The request is to optimize package structure with deep path imports and split proto definitions into smaller files for parallel type checking.

issues.title: [Bug] Nightly Stress CI is failing consistently
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Nightly stress CI tests are failing consistently due to a server-side issue with the in-memory SQLite database, preventing reliable detection of performance regressions in the TypeScript SDK.

issues.title: [Bug] Reusable VM allows context leak due to global variable reassignment
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: When `reuseV8Context` is enabled, global variable reassignments and deletions leak across workflow execution contexts because the context switching mechanism only tracks variable names, not their values. This allows one workflow's modifications to be visible in another workflow's context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support schedule search attribute update
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for updating search attributes on schedules in the TypeScript SDK, following the implementation in the Go SDK.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflows can be constructed in which update handlers do not, but should, execute
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Update handlers fail to execute when signals and updates are sent together in the same workflow task, causing the workflow to exit prematurely without running the update handler logic. The issue stems from update activation jobs not being grouped with signal jobs in the activation queue.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add website documentation for updates
issues.author: Cyberuben
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK documentation lacks coverage for the updates feature, which is already documented in other SDKs (Go, Java, PHP, Python, .NET). The request is to add TypeScript-specific documentation with code examples.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update schedule catchup window default value in documentation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update the default schedule catchup window value from 30 days to 1 year in the TypeScript SDK documentation and type definitions, aligning with changes made in the Temporal API.

issues.title: [Bug] Client should accept responses up to 128MB
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK's gRPC inbound message size limit is capped at 4MB, but should be increased to 128MB to match other SDKs and handle larger server responses.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow passing `pageSize` to `WorkflowHandle.fetchHistory`
issues.author: CiaranMn
issues.summary: Feature request to allow paginating through workflow histories larger than the 4MB gRPC limit by adding `pageSize` parameter to `fetchHistory()`. The issue was closed in favor of #1470 which identified this as a bug rather than a feature request.

issues.title: [Bug] Interceptors Don't Seem to Support Module Alias
issues.author: ccravens
issues.summary: Module alias imports (using module-alias package) don't work in workflow interceptors because the bundler doesn't recognize the aliases. User needs to configure webpack resolver aliases in bundleWorkflowCode() options.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow dev server version to be explicitly provided and mark some options as unstable
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to allow explicit dev server version specification in TypeScript SDK and mark unstable API options. The issue notes that version specification is already supported but suggests clarifying documentation about API stability, particularly for advanced arguments like 'extra args'.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support default/dynamic update handlers
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Feature request to add support for default/dynamic update handlers in the TypeScript SDK, similar to the existing setDefaultSignalHandler functionality.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support passing preloaded data converters to Client
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to allow Client and Activity-only Workers to accept pre-loaded DataConverter instances instead of requiring paths, reducing unnecessary build process complexity for non-Workflow components.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support "query" when listing schedules
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add query support when listing schedules in the TypeScript SDK, similar to the existing ListOptions functionality for workflows.

issues.title: Refactor stack trace queries to use new protos
issues.author: twin-drill
issues.summary: Refactor TypeScript SDK's stack trace query protobuf definitions to use updated proto structures, including renaming objects/fields and adding an `internal_code` flag to `FileLocation`.

issues.title: [Feature Request]  Accept search attributes in dev server startup
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to allow users to set search attributes in the dev server startup options, which would translate to --search-attribute command-line flags. This follows the CLI implementation in temporalio/cli#593.

issues.title: Workflow-friendly concurrency control
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Need a workflow-friendly concurrency control mechanism (mutex/semaphore) that is reentrant and deterministic for use within signal handlers, update handlers, and workflow coroutines.

issues.title: Testing
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Placeholder issue with minimal content containing only the word 'testing'.

issues.title: Testing
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: A minimal testing issue reported by the SDK team. The issue title and body both simply state 'testing' with no description, suggesting this may be a placeholder or incomplete report.

issues.title: [Bug] Failure to start ephemeral server prevents shutdown of the process
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Failure to start an ephemeral server (e.g., due to unsupported architecture) leaves the server in a failed state, preventing proper test cleanup and causing the process to hang during shutdown.

issues.title: [Bug] Emitted client metrics missing temporal_ prefix
issues.author: tsurdilo
issues.summary: Client metrics emitted by the TypeScript SDK are missing the 'temporal_' prefix that should be added by default. This regression was introduced in version 1.10.1, affecting metrics like request_failure and long_request_failure.

issues.title: [Bug] NestJS integration, app/worker hot reloading error
issues.author: tiberiu89
issues.summary: NestJS integration with Temporal SDK fails to restart the worker after code changes during hot reload due to port already in use error (3000). The issue occurs when using nest start worker --watch with nestjs-temporal package.

issues.title: Provide methods to wait for all handlers to finish
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request for methods to wait for all workflow handlers to finish before continuing as new or exiting the workflow. Users need to explicitly specify whether they want to await or ignore remaining handlers.

issues.title: Warn or error when update handlers dangle across CAN or workflow exit
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: SDK should warn or error when update handlers are not awaited before workflow completion (cancellation, failure, or success). This prevents silent handler abandonment and encourages best practices like using await-all-handlers or drop-all-handlers methods.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Simplify proper usage of `AsyncLocalStorage` in Workflow context
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: AsyncLocalStorage in Workflow context retains memory and adds performance overhead when not properly disposed. The SDK should track and automatically cleanup ALS instances when workflows are evicted from cache, and investigate providing a workflow-aware ALS implementation that scales better.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make it easier to diagnose failures to connect to Temporal Cloud due to incorrect `serverRootCACertificate`
issues.author: maxramqvist
issues.summary: Error messages when connecting to Temporal Cloud with an invalid serverRootCACertificate are cryptic, showing 'Failed to connect before the deadline' instead of a TLS-related error. User requests improved diagnostics to help troubleshoot certificate configuration issues.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Call Core worker.validate
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to call the Core worker.validate method on worker start/run, added in sdk-core PR #750, and propagate any validation errors to the user.

issues.title: [Bug] Latest update to v1.10.0 makes build fail
issues.author: johnrjj
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK v1.10.0 build fails with GLIBC_2.29 version error on Linux systems with older glibc versions (e.g., glibc 2.28). The core-bridge native module compiled for a newer glibc is incompatible with deployment environments using older glibc versions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add OTEL tracing information as attribute on log messages emitted using Workflow Logger
issues.author: lucaskatayama
issues.summary: Feature request to add OpenTelemetry trace_id and span_id attributes to workflow log messages. Currently these attributes appear in activity and client logs but are missing from workflow logs due to the sandboxed execution environment.

issues.title: [Bug] Unexpected behaviour related to CancellationScope.nonCancellable
issues.author: zijianzz
issues.summary: CancellationScope.nonCancellable does not prevent cancellation when a condition has a timeout, allowing CancelledFailure to propagate into the nonCancellable scope. The root issue is that timeouts are implemented via a cancellable CancellationScope that inherits cancellation from parent scopes even when nested inside a nonCancellable scope.

issues.title: Wrap GRPC::CANCELED and DEADLINE_EXCEEDED in an SDK Timeout exception for Update
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Wrap GRPC CANCELED and DEADLINE_EXCEEDED errors in a unified SDK Timeout exception for the Update feature, allowing users to catch a single predictable exception instead of handling multiple gRPC error types.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Do not set workflow completion until after all coroutines have settled in the task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Delay workflow completion until all coroutines have settled in the task queue to prevent dropping post-terminal commands. This aligns with core SDK requirements and follows patterns implemented in Python and .NET SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Clean API to intentionally fail an activity in long-polling patterns
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Request for a clean API to intentionally fail activities in long-polling patterns without generating excessive WARN-level logs. The activity should support retryable failures when no new data is available.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Failures thrown from within the update handler should be able to fail the workflow
issues.author: ThomasBurgess2000
issues.summary: Feature request to allow ApplicationFailure exceptions thrown from within update handlers to fail the workflow directly, instead of requiring a workaround with flags and conditional logic in the workflow code.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Cloud Operations API Client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a separate Cloud Operations API client for the TypeScript SDK using cloud protos, marked as experimental. This aligns with similar implementations in other SDKs like Go.

issues.title: [chore] Update repo to NPM 7 workspaces
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Update the TypeScript SDK repository to use native NPM 7 workspaces instead of Lerna, now that Node 14 support was dropped. This issue became obsolete as the repository was later transitioned to PNPM.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Warn when runtime can't shutdown due left over `NativeConnection`
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Request to emit warning messages when NativeConnection objects are left open after their associated Worker completes, helping users identify forgotten close() calls that prevent process shutdown.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Client replacement in worker
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to enable runtime replacement of the worker client with a new client instance that may be configured with different options (e.g., updated TLS certificates). This allows workers to reconnect with new credentials without restarting.

issues.title: [Bug]Could not resolve "__temporal_custom_payload_converter"
issues.author: tiagomendonc
issues.summary: User unable to build TypeScript SDK application with Worker due to unresolved module '__temporal_custom_payload_converter'. The issue stems from bundling the Worker and requires clarification on setup and bundling approach.

issues.title: [Bug] Check worker code for unsafe type assertions
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Review and validate all type assertions in the TypeScript SDK where protobuf fields are assumed to be non-null despite not being technically guaranteed by the type system. Fix any unsafe assertions that could cause unexpected errors if server behavior changes.

issues.title: [Bug] Some TS Worker errors while processing a Task may cause complete Worker failure
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Unexpected errors during Activity Task processing in TypeScript Worker can cause complete Worker failure due to null values and TypeErrors not being caught. This requires proper error handling on the TypeScript side since Core cannot handle these exceptions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make startUpdate users aware that it's synchronous w/ worker
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Feature request to make startUpdate API users aware that it's synchronous with the worker. The API parameter should not be optional and users need clarity on synchronous behavior.

issues.title: [Feature Request] search attributes update on schedule
issues.author: jesse-triplewhale
issues.summary: Feature request to support updating search attributes on schedules in the TypeScript SDK. The SDK was not exposing this capability in the schedule update operation, limiting users' ability to manage schedule-level search attributes.

issues.title: [Bug] `Workflow referenced an unregistered external sink` when using `@temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry`
issues.author: HalfdanJ
issues.summary: User encountered "Workflow referenced an unregistered external sink" errors when using OpenTelemetry interceptors with bundled workflow code. The issue was resolved by ensuring proper `sinks` configuration on the Worker, but documentation lacked clear guidance on this requirement.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Await multiple signals in a workflow
issues.author: jacek-rzrz
issues.summary: User requested a way to await multiple signals in a workflow, similar to JVM SDK's Workflow.await(). Their current workaround using a polling loop with sleep is causing OutOfMemory issues due to unbounded loop caching.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Better error details on why ephemeral test server didn't start
issues.author: mikeroelens
issues.summary: Ephemeral test server startup failures in CI provide no error details about why the server failed to start. Users only see a generic timeout error after 5 seconds with no indication of the root cause.

issues.title: Expose defaultConnection() method to switch between localhost and cloud based on env
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: Request to expose a defaultConnection() method that can switch between localhost and cloud-based Temporal connections based on environment variables. This would enable sample repositories to easily run in cloud environments without code changes.

issues.title: Support for WorkflowIdConflictPolicy
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: Add support for WorkflowIdConflictPolicy in TypeScript SDK to handle workflow ID conflicts consistently with other Temporal SDKs. This feature request includes implementation of the policy for the SignalWithStart API as well.

issues.title: [Bug] crypto.getRandomValues not supported
issues.author: acheong08
issues.summary: User encountered `crypto.getRandomValues() not supported` error when using the uuid npm package in workflow code. The issue was resolved by explaining that workflow code must be deterministic and recommending the use of `uuid4` from `@temporalio/workflow` package or moving UUID generation to activities.

issues.title: [Bug] Inconsistent Type Definition of Workflow Arguments
issues.author: hiramhuang
issues.summary: Type definition of workflow arguments is inconsistent between the `Workflow` type (using `any[]`) and `WithWorkflowArgs` type (using `[any, ...any[]]`), making it impossible to create generic types that extend `Workflow` while satisfying `WorkflowStartOptions`.

issues.title: [Feature Request] HTTP CONNECT proxy support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add HTTP CONNECT proxy support to the TypeScript SDK for both workers and gRPC clients, following implementation patterns from sdk-core and sdk-python.

issues.title: [Bug] Page size filter in @temporalio/client list method doesn't seem to be working properly
issues.author: Thexumaker
issues.summary: The pageSize parameter in temporalClient.list() doesn't work as expected—returning thousands of results instead of the specified page size of 1. User cannot test pagination functionality and needs clarification on proper usage.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use macOS M1/ARM runners for all SDK CI
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to use macOS M1/ARM runners for all SDK CI/CD pipelines to improve build performance and reduce costs on Apple Silicon hardware.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support metric option for using seconds (and other recent core metric changes)
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for Prometheus metric option to use seconds for duration measurements in TypeScript SDK, following recent core metric changes from sdk-core PR #706.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Queueing a workflow
issues.author: baileywickham
issues.summary: Feature request to add native workflow queueing/buffering capability similar to executeChild, allowing workflows to queue subsequent executions without creating schedules or clients. Current workaround uses schedules with BUFFER_ONE policy but has limitations like inability to pass arguments.

issues.title: [Feature Request] SDK should not return an update handle if the update has not reached the desired state
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to prevent the SDK from returning an update handle when the update has not reached the desired state, addressing consistency in update state handling.

issues.title: [Feature Request]  SDK clients should set a UpdateID on any update request even if the user did not specify one
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Feature request to ensure SDK clients automatically set an UpdateID on update requests even when users don't explicitly specify one. The issue was resolved as the functionality was already implemented in the codebase.

issues.title: [Bug] FailureConverters should not be reported as PayloadConverters in error messages
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Error messages from FailureConverters incorrectly identify themselves as PayloadConverters. The error messages need to be made more generic using template variables and use failure converter-specific methods where needed.

issues.title: [Feature Request] API key client option
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add API key client option to the TypeScript SDK, following the feature specification outlined in the cross-repo features issue.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support weighted random polling multiple task queues
issues.author: knpwrs
issues.summary: Feature request to support weighted random polling of multiple task queues in the TypeScript SDK to implement priority-like functionality and prevent starvation, similar to Faktory workers. The maintainer indicated this requires platform-level support from the Temporal server.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Worker.runReplayHistory() should accept a serialized History object fetched using fetchHistory()
issues.author: jhecking
issues.summary: Worker.runReplayHistory() doesn't automatically handle serialized History objects from fetchHistory(). Users must manually convert with History.fromObject(), creating confusion since the method already handles Web UI/CLI JSON formats differently.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Custom Workflow/Activity Resolver
issues.author: tim37021
issues.summary: User requests a custom workflow name resolver for the TypeScript SDK Worker to support prefixed workflow names (e.g., 'slack.postMessage') for better organization when multiple teams contribute workflows, similar to the existing activity mapping capability.
