issues.title: [Feature request] WorkerStatus does not have numInFlightLocalActivities
issues.author: Irvenae
issues.summary: WorkerStatus API lacks visibility into the number of concurrent local activities, making it impossible to monitor load across all three task slot types (workflows, activities, and local activities). The user requests a numInFlightLocalActivities field similar to the existing numInFlightActivities.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Configurable workflow failure exception types
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to make workflow failure exception types configurable in the TypeScript SDK. The request references a cross-SDK features issue for implementation guidance.

issues.title: [Bug] `reuseV8Context` breaks workflow isolation
issues.author: neelance
issues.summary: The `reuseV8Context` feature in v1.9.0 breaks workflow isolation by allowing global variables and module state to leak between workflow runs. Users discovered that cleanup steps and signal handlers persisted across different workflow executions when using a shared V8 context.

issues.title: [Bug] some metrics are not prefixed with "temporal_"
issues.author: antmendoza
issues.summary: Some metrics emitted by the TypeScript SDK are not prefixed with 'temporal_' (specifically 'request' and 'long_request'), a regression introduced in v1.9.0. The issue appears to stem from unprefixed metrics coming from the Rust client.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support Pino as a logging framework with Runtime.install
issues.author: paymog
issues.summary: Feature request to support Pino as a logging framework alongside Winston in the TypeScript SDK. The issue was ultimately closed as the team decided the SDK should remain logger-framework agnostic, but maintainers provided guidance on implementing custom logging adapters.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support updating schedule by cronExpression
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK lacks support for updating schedules by cronExpression alone, causing issues with duplicate intervals and upcoming runs when attempting to update only the cron expression.

issues.title: [Bug] Dependency issue when installing @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry v1.9.0
issues.author: domarp-j
issues.summary: The @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry package v1.9.0 has a peer dependency conflict with @temporalio/activity, requiring file:// references instead of version numbers. This prevents installation even though other packages can be updated to v1.9.0 successfully.

issues.title: Expose next retry delay on Application Failure in all SDKs
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Expose the next retry delay field (recently added to the API) on ApplicationFailure across all SDKs. This field allows activities to specify custom retry delays on failure and needs to be surfaced in the SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Eager Workflow Start
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Add support for Eager Workflow Start (EWS) in the TypeScript SDK, a feature that reduces workflow start latency by allowing clients to schedule the first workflow task directly to a local worker. This feature is already supported in Java, Python, Core, and Go SDKs and depends on another TypeScript SDK issue.

issues.title: [Bug] listWorkflowExecutions without namespace throws an exception.
issues.author: kakopappa
issues.summary: listWorkflowExecutions API call throws 'Namespace is empty' error when namespace parameter is omitted. The namespace should be marked as mandatory in the API to provide better developer guidance.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Prevent overriding of built-in query handlers
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Feature request to prevent application code from modifying built-in query handlers that start with `__temporal` prefix, ensuring that core functionality like the Temporal UI continues to work correctly.

issues.title: [Bug] Runtime fails to start with OtelCollectorExporter configured
issues.author: ksapchuk
issues.summary: Runtime fails to start with OtelCollectorExporter configured in SDK 1.9.0 due to missing required 'headers' field that should be optional. The telemetry options crash during Runtime.install() unless an empty headers map is explicitly provided.

issues.title: [Bug] Malformed Page for `workflow.Trigger` in TypeScript SDK API Reference
issues.author: tomwheeler
issues.summary: The API reference page for `workflow.Trigger` displays malformed content with raw markdown syntax visible to users instead of being properly rendered. The example code section shows an HTML comment and markdown fence markers as literal text rather than being interpreted correctly.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add workflow update tests to nightly suite
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The workflow update feature was added to the TypeScript SDK but lacks comprehensive stress testing in the nightly CI suite. This request is to add workflow update tests to the nightly test suite to ensure the feature is robust under various conditions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Run temporal worker in bun
issues.author: Code2Life
issues.summary: Request to support Bun runtime for Temporal workers. User encountered multiple issues when attempting to run Temporal workers with Bun: hook initialization failures and core-bridge panics due to hash table capacity overflow in the native bindings.

issues.title: [Feature Request] `TestWorkflowEnvironment` should support non-spawned servers
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: TestWorkflowEnvironment should support connecting to already-running servers instead of always spawning new ones, allowing developers to run integration tests against persistent servers with UI and history.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Schedule creation should create tracing span by default
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to automatically create tracing spans for schedule creation when the tracing interceptor is active, with workflow header integration and opt-out capability for users.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.9.0-rc.0.tgz: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 8.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency security vulnerability report for nyc-test-coverage package with 2 transitive vulnerabilities: CVE-2023-45133 in traverse (CVSS 8.8) and CVE-2022-25883 in semver (CVSS 7.5). Issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable library is no longer part of the Mend inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Validate input
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to improve error messages when invalid arguments are passed to client.workflow.start(). Currently shows opaque error for incorrect args format (object instead of array).

issues.title: [Bug] Throwing an exception from a workflow may result in `Failed to activate workflow` due to `DataCloneError`
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Throwing non-Error objects with non-serializable properties from workflows causes DataCloneError and activation failure. The error message obscures the original exception, making debugging difficult. The issue requests better error handling or earlier serialization to provide context about non-serializable objects.

issues.title: Missing test coverage for Prometheus server
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Prometheus metrics server is broken in v1.9.0-rc.0 when configured with Runtime.install(). Tests are missing to catch this regression.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose `updateId` to Update handlers
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to expose `updateId` to Update handlers in the TypeScript SDK for deduplication across continue-as-new boundaries. Currently, updateId is only available to workflow interceptors, not to the update handler itself.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.9.0-rc.0.tgz: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 8.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Two transitive dependency vulnerabilities were detected in the TypeScript SDK test coverage package: @babel/traverse (CVE-2023-45133, CVSS 8.8) allowing arbitrary code execution during compilation, and semver (CVE-2022-25883, CVSS 7.5) vulnerable to ReDoS attacks. The issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable libraries were no longer part of the inventory.

issues.title: [Bug] Comment unclear on when activities are cancelled after calling `Worker.shutdown`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The comment in the Worker.shutdown() method should clarify that activities are cancelled after the shutdownGraceTime expires, not immediately when shutdown is called.

issues.title: [Chore] Add tests to assert proper type rules on all "user defined function with args" APIs
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Add comprehensive type safety tests for user-defined function APIs across signals, updates, queries, workflows, activities, and schedules to catch type coherency deficiencies that could allow incorrect user code to compile.

issues.title: Add getUpdateHandle
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Add a getUpdateHandle() method to workflowHandle to obtain an UpdateHandle given update and workflow execution identifiers.

issues.title: [Bug] Node discards promises created by calling into Core Bridge with callback
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Node.js discards promises created by the bridge-to-rust layer when callbacks are passed to non-node threads (e.g., Tokio runtime), causing unexpected process exits with code 13. The issue occurs because callbacks aren't marked as "referenced" by native code, and Neon doesn't expose the Thread Safe Functions API needed to fix it.

issues.title: [chore] test: Upgrade the CLI to the latest
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: The test framework is using an outdated version of the CLI for creating ephemeral test servers, which prevents testing of the latest features like those introduced in #1300.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support using the pure JS `Connection` to power a `Worker`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Support using the pure JavaScript Connection class to power Workers instead of requiring NativeConnection. This would unify the two separate connection implementations, enable exposing the worker's connection to activities, and support eager workflow start.

issues.title: this can be undefined in async context
issues.author: giuliohome
issues.summary: The `this` context becomes undefined when destructuring methods from Context.current() and calling them from a new async context, because arrow functions weren't used. This breaks the pattern of importing sleep/other context methods before use.

issues.title: [Bug] ESM Custom payload converters cannot be loaded
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: ESM custom payload converters fail to load because the SDK uses `require()` instead of dynamic `import()` to load them. Users get an ERR_REQUIRE_ESM error when trying to use ESM modules as custom payload converters.

issues.title: [Bug] Custom payload converter not being passed to "Activator"
issues.author: nohehf
issues.summary: Custom payload converter works for encoding but fails during activity resolution with 'Unknown encoding' error. Issue stems from ESM bundling of the custom converter - the converter is passed correctly for initial workflow activation but fails when activities complete.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow manual pagination when listing workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users need the ability to manually control pagination when listing workflows in the TypeScript SDK. The request is for the SDK to return pagination tokens and allow users to provide those tokens on subsequent calls, similar to how the Python SDK implements this feature.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Eliminate glue code
issues.author: vwkd
issues.summary: Feature request to reduce boilerplate code in the TypeScript SDK by allowing direct imports and calls to workflows and activities as regular functions, and passing them directly to Worker configuration instead of using proxy functions and path specifications.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support Deno
issues.author: vwkd
issues.summary: Feature request to add Deno support to the TypeScript SDK. The request would enable developers to write Temporal code using Deno's native Web APIs and run TypeScript without a build step.

issues.title: [Bug] Activity logger does not serialize Error objects
issues.author: shawnjones253
issues.summary: Activity logger does not serialize Error objects passed as metadata arguments, only showing the Context object instead. The issue occurs when passing Error objects as the second argument to log.error(), but works correctly for uncaught errors.

issues.title: Bundle using Vite
issues.author: gajus
issues.summary: Request to support Vite as a bundler for TypeScript SDK instead of Webpack, which is slow (10+ second builds). Community members suggest esbuild as a faster alternative, with one user reporting 0.6s production builds.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add NativeClient keep alive support
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to expose NativeClient keep-alive options that are already enabled by default in SDK core. The request was closed as the team determined that long polls used by the worker are a suitable replacement for keep-alive functionality.

issues.title: [Bug] Error not serialized fully when sent to Sinks
issues.author: marcoreni
issues.summary: Error objects sent to Sink functions lose important fields (type, details, custom ApplicationFailure properties) due to structured clone serialization limitations in postMessage. When errors are transferred from worker threads to the main thread, only basic Error properties (name, message, stack) are preserved.

issues.title: TransportError: tonic::transport::Error(Transport, hyper::Error(Connect, ConnectError("tcp connect error", Os { code: 99, kind: AddrNotAvailable, message: "Cannot assign requested address" })))
issues.author: mxvsh
issues.summary: Docker worker fails with TCP connection error (Cannot assign requested address) when started via docker run, but works when manually running the same command inside the container. The issue appears to be an environment or networking configuration problem specific to the container startup context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add minimal support to link core-bridge against musl
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK's core-bridge native library doesn't support musl-based systems (like Alpine Linux). Users need the ability to build musl-compatible native libraries to run workers in Alpine containers.

issues.title: [Bug] Webpack's output clog worker logs
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Webpack's log output is being called repeatedly with ANSI color sequences, making logs difficult to parse when captured by external logging systems like GitHub Actions or Datadog. The issue requests gathering Webpack log output into single, structured log entries.

issues.title: [Feature Request][TS] Expose `StartWorkflowOptions.workflowStartDelay`
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Add support for `StartWorkflowOptions.workflowStartDelay` that was recently introduced in the server. The API should expose this option to allow workflows to start with a specified delay.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.8.6.tgz: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 8.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Mend security vulnerability report for nyc-test-coverage package with 2 high-severity vulnerabilities in transitive dependencies: CVE-2023-45133 in @babel/traverse (CVSS 8.8) and CVE-2022-25883 in semver (CVSS 7.5). Issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable library was removed from the project inventory.

issues.title: [Bug] MockActivityEnvironment holds open handle prevents jest from exiting
issues.author: shawnjones253
issues.summary: MockActivityEnvironment instantiation holds open a neon threadsafe function handle that prevents Jest from exiting cleanly. The issue occurs even if the environment is never used to run activities.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide nicer error messages on TLS CA cert not found errors
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Users encounter cryptic and inconsistent TLS CA certificate error messages when running in slim Docker images without root CA certificates. The error message lacks clarity on what users need to do to resolve the issue.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Deprecate `appendDefaultInterceptors`
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: The `appendDefaultInterceptors()` function is easy to miss and causes poor developer experience. This feature request asks to make workflow and activity logging work by default without requiring this explicit call, then deprecate the function.

issues.title: [Bug] module is not defined
issues.author: divmgl
issues.summary: ESBuild-compiled CommonJS workflow bundles fail with 'module is not defined' error when executed in the Temporal workflow VM. The issue occurs because the VM context doesn't provide CommonJS globals like `module` and `exports`.

issues.title: [Bug] Unable to provide Authorization header for a client Connection - CallCredentials does not appear to work
issues.author: atomicleopard
issues.summary: CallCredentials and ChannelCredentials are not being applied to gRPC connections, preventing users from sending Authorization headers for secured Temporal clusters. The issue stems from credentials being dropped during connection setup when TLS is not used.

issues.title: [Bug] Properties of `WorkflowInfo` and `Activity.Context` should not be mutable by user code
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: WorkflowInfo and Activity.Context objects returned by user code can be mutated, including dangerous mutations like flipping isReplaying which breaks the patched() API. Objects should be immutable to prevent unintended side effects.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.8.6.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: A ReDoS vulnerability (CVE-2022-25883) was detected in the semver dependency (version 7.5.0) transitive through ts-loader. The issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from the inventory.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.8.5.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in semver package (CVE-2022-25883) used by ts-loader, causing a Regular Expression Denial of Service vulnerability with CVSS score 7.5. Issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable library was removed from the project's dependency tree.

issues.title: [Bug] `nyc-test-coverage` is excessively difficult to use correctly
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: The @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage package is difficult to use correctly and fragile, causing users to encounter various errors (invalid coverage objects, incorrect coverage reports) despite following documentation. The issue requires both tool improvements for resilience and better usage documentation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Typed Search Attributes
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to implement typed search attributes for the TypeScript SDK, as defined in the cross-SDK proposal. This would provide type-safe access to search attributes in workflows and activities.

issues.title: Unknown typescript syntax.
issues.author: azakaryan
issues.summary: TypeScript compiler error in deprecated-time.ts due to unfamiliar syntax that requires TypeScript 5.1 or later to properly recognize.

issues.title: [Feature Request] register custom search attribute on `TestWorkflowEnvironment`
issues.author: Yihao-G
issues.summary: User requested a `registerSearchAttribute` method on `TestWorkflowEnvironment` to register custom search attributes for testing, similar to the Java SDK. The issue was self-resolved when the user discovered the functionality already exists via `connection.operatorService.addSearchAttributes()`, but the API is poorly documented.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add support for custom metrics
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Add support for custom metrics in the TypeScript SDK following the pattern established by DotNET and Python SDKs. This includes updating to the latest Core SDK, ensuring existing Prometheus and OpenTelemetry options work correctly, adding user-facing metrics APIs, and removing Tracing support.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.8.4.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: A Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability was discovered in semver 7.5.0, a transitive dependency through ts-loader in the nyc-test-coverage package. The vulnerability allows untrusted user data to cause high availability impact, and was resolved when the vulnerable library was removed from the project.

issues.title: [Clarification] Behavior of `signalWithStart`
issues.author: samwaterbury
issues.summary: User seeks clarification on signalWithStart behavior after release notes mentioned throwing WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError. The official documentation suggests it should signal without error if workflow is running, creating confusion about whether this is a regression.

issues.title: [Bug] `RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded` on Worker shutdown
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Worker crashes with RangeError during shutdown when log forwarding is enabled due to infinite recursion in RxJS repeat operator. The issue only occurs with log forwarding configuration and doesn't happen with alternative logging filter options.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose `originalExecutionRunId` in `workflowInfo`
issues.author: PenguinToast
issues.summary: Feature request to expose `originalExecutionRunId` in `workflowInfo()` to enable deterministic PRNG seeding that remains stable through Resets but changes on Continue-As-New/Cron operations.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.8.4.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency semver 7.5.0 has a ReDoS vulnerability (CVE-2022-25883) with CVSS score 7.5. The vulnerable package is pulled in through ts-loader, affecting the test coverage build artifact.

issues.title: @temporalio/client-1.8.4.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Critical prototype pollution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36665) in protobufjs 7.2.3, a transitive dependency of @temporalio/client. The vulnerability allows attackers to pollute Object.prototype through malicious protobuf messages, with a CVSS score of 9.8.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.8.3.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Semver 7.5.0 contains a ReDoS vulnerability (CVE-2022-25883) with CVSS score 7.5, affecting nyc-test-coverage as a transitive dependency through ts-loader. The issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was no longer part of the inventory.

issues.title: client-1.8.3.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Prototype Pollution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36665) in protobufjs 7.2.3 with CVSS score of 9.8, allowing attackers to pollute Object.prototype through untrusted protobuf messages. The issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add retry configuration to activity info
issues.author: scott-rc
issues.summary: Activity interceptors need access to retry configuration to determine if an activity is on its final attempt, enabling selective error reporting to monitoring services.

issues.title: [Bug] `workflow.log` fails when using `nyc-test-coverage`
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: The defaultWorkerLogger sink fails to register automatically when using @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage's augmentWorkerOptions without explicitly setting WorkerOptions.sinks. Users must manually specify sinks: defaultSinks() as a workaround.

issues.title: [Bug] Type Definition Improvement for `ActivityFunction` Interface
issues.author: JaredRohe
issues.summary: Type definitions for proxyActivities incorrectly return type `symbol` when wrapping synchronous (non-Promise-returning) activity functions, causing TypeScript errors and requiring manual type casting.

issues.title: Cron job getting scheduled after deployment and Terminated automatically after 1 minute or so
issues.author: Naik1994
issues.summary: Cron job workflow gets terminated automatically shortly after deployment, either immediately after scheduling or mid-execution. User experiencing issues with cron job reliability on AWS ECS despite setting workflowRunTimeout and workflowTaskTimeout.

issues.title: [Bug] Metric `workflow_task_execution_failed` doesn't have correct tags
issues.author: rupalivohra
issues.summary: The metric `workflow_task_execution_failed` is missing the `workflow_type` tag after upgrading from SDK 1.6.0 to 1.8.2, making it difficult to route alerts by workflow type. The `task_queue` tag works correctly.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Workflow rollback
issues.author: burakakca
issues.summary: User requests a programmatic way to roll back workflow execution step-by-step by reverting the event history, rather than just resetting to the beginning. They want workflow logic to undo previous steps.

issues.title: [Bug] Typo in `defaultWorflowInterceptorModules` API
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Typo in the `defaultWorflowInterceptorModules` API name in the TypeScript SDK documentation and/or code. The API name should be `defaultWorkflowInterceptorModules` (with correct spelling of 'Workflow').

issues.title: Forwarded logs from the core do not include metadata
issues.author: neelance
issues.summary: Log entries forwarded from the core runtime lack metadata fields like workflow ID and run ID, making them non-actionable. The core has these fields available but they're not being extracted and passed to the TypeScript logger.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow bundle size increased by 1.5MB between 1.8.0 and 1.8.1
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Workflow bundle size increased by approximately 1.5MB in version 1.8.1 due to an unintended dependency on the protobuf package being imported in workflow.ts, causing bundle bloat.

issues.title: [Bug] @temporalio/worker-1.7.4: Memory occupied by worker not getting released on AWS ECS (OS: Linux)
issues.author: Naik1994
issues.summary: Memory occupied by worker instances on AWS ECS Linux environments is not being released after load testing, while the same code works properly on Windows. Setting maxCachedWorkflows to 0 releases memory but causes performance degradation.

issues.title: @temporalio/client-1.8.2.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Critical prototype pollution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36665) in protobufjs 7.2.3 transitive dependency with CVSS score of 9.8. The vulnerability allows attackers to pollute Object.prototype through untrusted protobuf messages.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.8.2.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in semver 7.5.0 (CVE-2022-25883) causing Regular Expression Denial of Service. The vulnerability was resolved by updating the dependency chain through ts-loader.

issues.title: Bundling raw typescript fails
issues.author: GauBen
issues.summary: Worker.create fails to bundle ESM written in TypeScript when imports use .js extensions for .ts files. The bundler cannot resolve the modules because the physical .ts files don't have .js extensions, causing webpack resolution errors.

issues.title: [Bug] worker.Shutdown() results into a Shutdown exception
issues.author: attriaayush
issues.summary: Worker shutdown in v1.8.1 causes a ShutdownError exception that terminates Jest with exit code 1, breaking test suites. Downgrading to v1.7.4 resolves the issue.

issues.title: [Bug] `Context.current().info.heartbeatTimeoutMs` is undefined
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The `Context.current().info.heartbeatTimeoutMs` property is undefined in the TypeScript SDK, while it should contain the heartbeat timeout value for activities.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Forward Core's metrics to TypeScript-land
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Forward metrics from Core SDK to TypeScript SDK to enable custom metrics handling, filtering, and export to external collectors. This requires implementing support for accepting and handling metrics from Core.

issues.title: [Support] Activating a workflow causes "Automatic publicPath is not supported in this browser" (error when using node but not node-ts)
issues.author: doodledood
issues.summary: Worker fails with "Automatic publicPath is not supported in this browser" error when running compiled JavaScript via node, but works with ts-node. Root cause identified as third-party packages importing browser-specific modules into the workflow bundle.

issues.title: [Bug] SDK should drop signals for which it cannot decode payloads
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK should drop signals with unparseable payloads instead of failing, matching behavior in Go and Java SDKs. This prevents runtime errors when signal arguments cannot be deserialized.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Sentry integration
issues.author: hwang251
issues.summary: Feature request for out-of-the-box Sentry integration to simplify error logging in TypeScript SDK activities. Currently requires implementing a custom ActivityInboundCallsInterceptor.

issues.title: [Bug] ProtobufJSONPayloadConverter needs Buffer to encode/decode binary protobuf fields
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: The ProtobufJSONPayloadConverter cannot handle binary protobuf fields because it requires Node.js Buffer class which is not accessible in workflow context. This prevents workflows from encoding/decoding protobufs with binary data using this converter.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.8.1.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in semver (CVE-2022-25883) affecting the test coverage library. A Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability was identified in semver-7.5.0 with a CVSS score of 7.5.

issues.title: client-1.8.1.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Critical prototype pollution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36665) in protobufjs 7.2.3 transitive dependency with CVSS score of 9.8. Vulnerability allows attackers to pollute Object.prototype through untrusted protobuf message processing.

issues.title: client-1.8.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Prototype pollution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36665) in protobufjs transitive dependency with CVSS 5.5 score. The issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable library was no longer part of the inventory.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.8.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.3) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in semver (CVE-2022-25883) detected in nyc test coverage package, causing a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability. Issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable library was removed from the inventory.

issues.title: [Typescript] Workflow update support
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to add workflow update support to the TypeScript SDK, allowing workflows to be updated without losing state.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.8.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.3) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: A ReDoS vulnerability (CVE-2022-25883) was detected in the semver dependency (version 7.5.0) used transitively through ts-loader. The issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable library is no longer part of the inventory.

issues.title: [Support] How to cache data between different interceptors
issues.author: YufeeXing
issues.summary: User asks how to cache data (like authentication headers) between multiple interceptors in the workflow context, similar to thread-local storage in Java. The issue involves using local activities in interceptors to authenticate values and pass them to other interceptors.

issues.title: [Bug] Client.schedule.create is giving "Schedule not found" error if namespace is incorrect
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Client.schedule.create() returns incorrect 'Schedule not found' error when using a non-existent namespace, instead of reporting that the namespace itself doesn't exist. Similar error handling issues likely affect other ScheduleClient and WorkflowClient methods.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add support for capturing Workflow test coverage data using Jest
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Jest doesn't work well with the existing @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage package for capturing workflow test coverage data due to Jest's deep integration with Node internals and custom code transformers. A new approach is needed to support Jest alongside the existing Mocha and AVA support.

issues.title: [Bug] Binary and protobuf payload converters break Uint8Array type equality
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Payload converters in the workflow context return objects (like Uint8Array) that use constructors from the node context, breaking instanceof checks and third-party libraries. Additionally, some converters rely on the Buffer class which is not visible in the workflow context.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.7.4.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.3) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in semver 7.5.0 (ReDoS) found via nyc-test-coverage dependency chain. The issue was automatically resolved when the vulnerable library was removed from the inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] TemporalFailure from converters and codecs should be able to fail the workflow not task
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to allow TemporalFailure instances from converters and codecs to fail the entire workflow, not just individual tasks. Currently, failures in these components only fail the task, but users need the ability to propagate critical failures to the workflow level.

issues.title: [Support] How to implement a real Authorization workflow inbound interceptor
issues.author: YufeeXing
issues.summary: User asks how to implement authorization in a workflow inbound interceptor that validates headers via a remote authentication service in different environments, given that the 'process' API is forbidden in workflow interceptors for determinism.

issues.title: [Bug] Pin dependencies
issues.author: leeweisberger
issues.summary: A bug in the unionfs dependency caused a company-wide outage for users of @temporalio/worker due to an unpinned transitive dependency. The discussion explores whether pinning dependencies is the right approach to prevent similar issues.

issues.title: Temporal SDK Changes how javascript is being executed
issues.author: tareksalem
issues.summary: User expects activity errors to be caught in workflow try-catch blocks, but Temporal automatically retries failed activities instead. The user wants to decide retry policy at the workflow level rather than in the activity itself.

issues.title: [Bug] tsc in a project created with `npx @temporalio/create` fails on Node 20
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: TypeScript compilation fails in projects created with `npx @temporalio/create` on Node 20 because the `es2023` library definitions are not available in the pinned TypeScript 4.x version. The create tool updates `@tsconfig/node16` to `@tsconfig/node20`, which references `es2023`, but the project still uses TypeScript 4.x which doesn't support that library.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `upsertMemo` command
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Add `upsertMemo` command to the TypeScript Workflow API. The underlying support already exists in the Core SDK and just needs to be exposed.

issues.title: [Bug] Temporal worker fails to start if I am using class transformer
issues.author: tareksalem
issues.summary: Temporal TypeScript worker fails to start when workflow code imports classes or libraries with non-deterministic dependencies like NestJS. The workflow bundler cannot include modules with I/O, network calls, or environment variable access due to sandbox constraints.

issues.title: [Bug] @temporalio/create produces unbuildable hello-world project
issues.author: cameronpickham
issues.summary: The @temporalio/create scaffolding tool generates a hello-world project with TypeScript ^4.4.2, but this version is incompatible with tsconfig/node20 which requires TypeScript >= 5 due to es2023 lib configuration.

issues.title: Workflow Task Failed with Unspecified Cause
issues.author: Uria1
issues.summary: Workflow tasks fail with unspecified cause when activities started in parallel lack proper error handling, causing the workflow to remain in running state instead of failing properly and preventing catch blocks from executing.

issues.title: [Bug] `.cancel()` does not exists on child workflow handles
issues.author: laura-turner-divvy
issues.summary: ChildWorkflowHandle lacks a `.cancel()` method despite JSDoc claiming it can cancel workflow execution. Users must work around this limitation when needing to cancel child workflows created with `startChild()`.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Create a `npx @temporalio/doctor` command
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Create a `@temporalio/doctor` CLI tool that can be executed via `npx` to diagnose and fix common configuration issues in Temporal TypeScript SDK projects, such as version mismatches, unexpected package hoisting, deprecated dependencies, and known bugs.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow Bundler does not deny usage of the `process` global variable
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: The Workflow Bundler does not prevent usage of the `process` global variable in workflow code, which is not available in the workflow sandbox environment, causing ReferenceError at execution time. The issue requires implementing a custom Webpack target that matches the sandbox's capabilities while maintaining compatibility with external libraries using conditional package.json exports.

issues.title: [Bug] unable to do npm install in a docker to build a container with a worker app since 1.7.3 temporal TS SDK was published
issues.author: kutovoy
issues.summary: npm install fails in Docker when building with TypeScript SDK 1.7.3 due to missing prebuilt binaries for the core-bridge native module, requiring Rust/Cargo to compile from source.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Permit imports of Node `buffer` module in workflows
issues.author: silasdavis
issues.summary: Feature request to allow importing Node's built-in `buffer` module in workflows. Currently all builtin modules are blocked; user needs buffer for domain type conversion logic and believes it's deterministic and safe.

issues.title: [Bug] `CalendarSpec` components not encoded correctly
issues.author: florianmorath
issues.summary: CalendarSpec components for hour and dayOfMonth are encoded with incorrect validation ranges, rejecting valid values. Hour field accepts 0-59 instead of 0-23, and dayOfMonth accepts 0-6 instead of 1-31.

issues.title: [Bug] Hang on starting workflow worker on NodeJS 18.14.2
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Workflow worker hangs when starting on NodeJS 18.14.2 in production Linux containers, but works fine on NodeJS 16.17.0. Investigation revealed the root cause was incorrectly configured Node heap options.

issues.title: [Bug] Duplicate name error when @temporalio/worker and @temporalio/testing both installed
issues.author: solastley
issues.summary: Duplicate name error occurs when @temporalio/worker and @temporalio/testing are both installed, causing a protobufjs namespace conflict with the ActivityHeartbeat type in the coresdk namespace.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow Webpack stats to be configured/disabled
issues.author: clintonb
issues.summary: Webpack stats are being automatically logged with color codes and multiline formatting, making logs difficult to read in third-party logging systems and wasting money on per-line charges. User requests the ability to configure or disable these stats via Webpack's existing stats configuration.

issues.title: [Bug] Make `ScheduleUpdateOptions.action.workflowId` optional
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The `workflowId` field in `ScheduleUpdateOptions.action` should be optional, matching the behavior in `ScheduleOptionsStartWorkflowAction` where it is already optional.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose URL and URLSearchParams to workflow sandbox
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to expose URL and URLSearchParams APIs to the workflow sandbox. These are deterministic APIs available in all major JS runtimes and would enable more flexible URL handling within workflows.

issues.title: [Bug] create-project cli doesn't take into account subdirectories when replacing node version
issues.author: jhubbardsf
issues.summary: The create-project CLI tool fails to update tsconfig.json and package.json files correctly when creating projects with subdirectories (like monorepo examples) on Node 18. The tool doesn't properly replace Node version references in nested directory structures.

issues.title: [Bug] 'too many filter conditions specified' on reasonable query
issues.author: jwaaang
issues.summary: User encountered 'too many filter conditions specified' error when querying active workflows using WorkflowClient.list() with a two-condition filter, while the same query works with direct gRPC calls to listWorkflowExecutions(). The issue was identified as a server limitation related to visibility database configuration, not an SDK bug.

issues.title: instanceof not working
issues.author: leran500
issues.summary: User reports that `instanceof` checks fail for ActivityError in workflows, even though the activity returns the error object. The error type checking only works when performed inside the activity before returning.

issues.title: [Proposal] Built-in registered handlers query
issues.author: josiah-roberts
issues.summary: Proposal for a built-in query mechanism to track which handlers (queries and signals) are currently registered in a workflow, enabling clients to determine which operations are legal to send at any given moment.

issues.title: temporal-client-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.1)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: A CVSS 9.1 severity vulnerability in the transitive dependency remove_dir_all-0.5.3 affects temporal-client-0.1.0, enabling arbitrary path deletion through TOCTOU race conditions. The issue was resolved by upgrading the dependency to remove_dir_all-0.8.0.

issues.title: core-2.3.0.tgz: 6 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 8.8)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Six npm package vulnerabilities detected in core-2.3.0.tgz dependencies, with the highest severity being 8.8 (CVE-2022-25967 in eta package enabling Remote Code Execution). Multiple transitive dependencies require updates to remediate security risks.

issues.title: temporal-sdk-core-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Temporal SDK Core has a transitive dependency vulnerability (CVE-2023-22895) in bzip2 0.4.3 that allows denial of service via integer overflow. The vulnerability has been fixed in bzip2 0.4.4, and the dependency was updated long ago.

issues.title: opentelemetry-0.18.0.crate: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: High-severity security vulnerability (CVSS 9.8) in transitive dependency bumpalo-3.11.0 due to use-after-free in Vec::into_iter() lifetime constraints. The vulnerability exists in OpenTelemetry 0.18.0 through its dependency chain.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add missing `repository` field to e.g. `@temporalio/activity`
issues.author: mcmxcdev
issues.summary: Package.json files for @temporalio packages are missing the `repository` field, which causes package audit tools to report warnings. Adding the repository configuration to each package's package.json would resolve this issue.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support countWorkflowExecutions
issues.author: jdnichollsc
issues.summary: User requested support for countWorkflowExecutions API in the TypeScript SDK to check if a workflow execution exists. The issue was resolved by using the alternative getHandle().describe() approach with status checking.

issues.title: [Feature Request] add string types for `ms` package
issues.author: akamos
issues.summary: Feature request to add typed string support for the `ms` package in the TypeScript SDK. The `sleep` method accepts both numbers and strings (via the `ms` package), but lacks proper type checking for valid ms-format strings, reducing type safety.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose enum for ExecutionStatus
issues.author: rupalivohra
issues.summary: Feature request to expose an enum for ExecutionStatus in workflow execution queries instead of using string literals. Users want type-safe access to execution status values like 'Running' rather than hardcoding strings.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Return well-formed error OR success if Worker.runReplayHistories receives no histories
issues.author: rupalivohra
issues.summary: Worker.runReplayHistories throws an unhelpful RxJS EmptyError when receiving zero histories instead of succeeding or returning a clear error code. The request is for either graceful handling of empty history sequences or a specific, catchable error code for empty input.

issues.title: [Bug] Temporal does not use standard AbortController/AbortSignal typings
issues.author: knpwrs
issues.summary: TypeScript type incompatibility between Temporal's abort-controller polyfill and standard library AbortSignal prevents using cancellationSignal with libraries expecting standard AbortSignal types. The SDK uses a third-party AbortController for Node 14 compatibility, causing type mismatches with newer versions that have the throwIfAborted method.

issues.title: listWorkflowExecutions accept only 1 query params.
issues.author: ethanclear
issues.summary: User reported that listWorkflowExecutions rejects queries with multiple filter conditions (AND operators), receiving 'too many filter conditions specified' error. Investigation revealed this is a server-side limitation based on the persistence backend, not an SDK bug.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow setting default activity options on worker creation
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to allow setting default activity options at worker creation time, similar to Java's WorkflowImplementationOptions.activityOptions, to enable configuration via config files or environment variables rather than hardcoding.

issues.title: [docs] Types are missing in the left nav bar of the exported API documentation
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK exported API documentation is missing type aliases, module-level functions, constants, and variables from the left navigation sidebar. These items can be reached through cross-references but aren't discoverable directly in the sidebar.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Propagate opentelemetry context to local activities
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to propagate OpenTelemetry context to local activities in the TypeScript SDK. Currently, only non-local activities and child workflows have traces attached to the workflow's span, creating inconsistency in observability.

issues.title: Power local test environment with Temporal CLI
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Enable local testing with Temporal CLI as an alternative to the current test environment setup, with continued support for Temporalite during the transition.

issues.title: Add `TelemetryOptions.logging` object format to API ref
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK API reference documentation shows `TelemetryOptions.logging` as a generic `Object` type without documenting the actual structure. This request asks for the logging object format to be properly documented in the API reference.

issues.title: [Bug] First activity heartbeat not sent right away
issues.author: stellarhoof
issues.summary: Activity cancellation is delayed because the first heartbeat is throttled. The issue reporter believed cancellation wouldn't be delivered until after the first heartbeat timeout, but investigation revealed the first heartbeat is sent immediately—the activity sample code just sleeps before calling heartbeat.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Retain type information regarding signal/query `name`
issues.author: josiah-roberts
issues.summary: Feature request to enhance TypeScript's SignalDefinition and QueryDefinition to retain type information about signal/query names, enabling type-safe enforcement of legal signals/queries at compile time.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Retain type information for signal/query `_Args`
issues.author: josiah-roberts
issues.summary: SignalDefinition and QueryDefinition discard their type parameter information due to structural typing, allowing type-unsafe assignments like SignalDefinition<[string]> being assignable to SignalDefinition<[number]>. This request proposes using a unique symbol type brand to preserve type information for improved type-level reasoning in helper functions.

issues.title: [CI flake] Schedules deadline exceeded
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Test suite fails intermittently with DEADLINE_EXCEEDED errors when creating and describing schedules in CI, causing CI flakes that impact build reliability.

issues.title: [Bug] `sleep('1 month')` results in UnhandledCommand WFT failure
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The `sleep()` function fails with UnhandledCommand WorkflowTaskFailed error when using ms-style duration strings like '1 month' that the ms library doesn't recognize, returning undefined instead of a number.

issues.title: core-2.3.0.tgz: 9 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 8.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Security vulnerability report for core-2.3.0.tgz containing 9 transitive dependencies with known CVEs, including high-severity remote code execution risk in eta (CVE-2022-25967, CVSS 8.8). Issue was automatically closed after vulnerabilities were resolved or removed from inventory.

issues.title: [Bug] Unhandled promise rejections results in hard to diagnose WFT failure
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Unhandled promise rejections in workflows cause WFT failures with insufficient context information, making it difficult to diagnose the root cause and locate where the failing promise was created. The issue is compounded by errors being misclassified as WFT failures instead of WF failures and information loss during V8 serialization.

issues.title: How to add module to disallowedModules?
issues.author: gajus
issues.summary: User needs to exclude modules from webpack bundling in the workflow bundler. The `ignoreModules` configuration doesn't work as documented, and the issue stems from webpack not compiling for the node target, causing it to fail processing node: namespace dependencies.

issues.title: preset-classic-2.2.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability in ua-parser-js dependency affecting the docs package through the preset-classic dependency chain. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 7.5 and can cause availability issues, but was automatically resolved when the dependency was removed from the inventory.

issues.title: [Bug] Silent crashes when awaiting promises returned from `Client` (using `hello-world` sample)
issues.author: yamen
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK client crashes silently when directly awaiting promises from methods like `client.workflow.start()`. The issue occurs due to a gRPC-js dependency version problem that causes the Node.js process to exit prematurely when async operations complete.

issues.title: opentelemetry-0.18.0.crate: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in bumpalo 3.11.0 through opentelemetry (CVSS 9.8) causes potential use-after-free memory safety issues. The vulnerability was automatically closed as it is no longer part of the dependency inventory.

issues.title: tokio-1.21.2.crate: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.4) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Tokio dependency version 1.21.2 contains a medium-severity vulnerability (CVE-2023-22466) where configuring pipe_mode on Windows named pipes resets reject_remote_clients to false, potentially allowing unauthorized remote access. This issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency inventory.

issues.title: [Chore] Upgrade @grpc/grpc-js to 1.8+
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Upgrade @grpc/grpc-js from ~1.7.3 to 1.8+ to address a security vulnerability (GHSA-cfgp-2977-2fmm), while handling conflicts with the integrated retry mechanism that would cause duplicate retries and validating the 10-second shutdown delay is resolved.

issues.title: [Bug] cannot spawn test-server
issues.author: MrMaximus
issues.summary: TestWorkflowEnvironment.create() fails in Docker environments due to test-server binary incompatibility with GLIBC versions. The testing library downloads the latest test-server release which may have incompatible system dependencies not satisfied in slim Docker images.

issues.title: [Bug] node takes 10 seconds to exit since @grpc/grpc-js 1.8.0
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Node process hangs for 10 seconds on exit when using @grpc/grpc-js 1.8.0+, likely due to uncleared deadline timers in the grpc retry mechanism. The team decided to pin to @grpc/grpc-js ~1.7.3 until they can properly upgrade.

issues.title: [Bug] Schedule client does not infer args based on workflow type
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: The Schedule client fails to infer workflow arguments based on the workflow type during schedule creation and update operations, affecting type safety for scheduling workflows.

issues.title: [Feature Request] async generator for cancellationScope
issues.author: Irvenae
issues.summary: User requests support for async generators within CancellationScope to implement update logic with nested cancellation scopes. The feature would allow yielding results from previous iterations while maintaining cancellation semantics across nested scopes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Start workers in debug mode if `TEMPORAL_DEBUG` env var is set
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to start workers in debug mode when the TEMPORAL_DEBUG environment variable is set, for consistency with other Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow strings to be passed for `tls.clientCertPair.crt/key`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to allow TLS client certificate and key to be passed as strings instead of Buffers, eliminating the need for Buffer.from() conversions when using environment variables.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support dynamic workflows, activities, signals, queries, and updates
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to support dynamic (catch-all) handlers for workflows, activities, signals, queries, and updates. Allows registering a single handler that receives the operation name and arguments for any unhandled operations of that type.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Opt-in to having stack trace query use custom data converter
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add a boolean worker option `stackTraceQueryUsesConverter` that controls whether the `__stack_trace` query response should use the custom data converter. This allows opt-in conversion behavior for stack trace queries.

issues.title: [Bug] ScheduleClient.list() fails to return any schedules
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: ScheduleClient.list() returns an empty array or incomplete schedule objects (only IDs without spec data) when querying schedules on app startup, despite schedules being visible in tctl and UI. The issue appears to be an eventual consistency or data serialization problem affecting the TypeScript SDK.

issues.title: Validate single version of packages
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Users accidentally install multiple versions of Temporal packages, causing runtime errors. Need validation to detect and prevent multiple versions of @temporalio packages from being used simultaneously in worker and workflow contexts.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide more output when webpack fails
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Webpack bundling for workflows fails with cryptic error messages that don't indicate which source files are causing dependency issues. Users need better diagnostic output to debug webpack failures during workflow bundling.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose currently configured payload converter to workflow code
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to expose the currently configured payload converter to workflow code, enabling use cases like custom headers and interceptors.

issues.title: [Bug] Some logs not being done with our custom logger
issues.author: jcm300
issues.summary: Custom logger configured via Runtime.install() was not receiving logs emitted from Rust core during worker startup and shutdown. User needed to configure log forwarding via telemetryOptions to receive all logs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `workflowInfo().startTime`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to expose the workflow start time through workflowInfo().startTime in the TypeScript SDK. This follows the API exposed in sdk-core PR #416.

issues.title: [Bug] Installing "@temporalio/testing:1.4.0" along with 1.5.2 libs (activity/client/worker/workflow) breaks Temporal
issues.author: Andrei199991
issues.summary: Installing @temporalio/testing@1.4.0 alongside upgraded 1.5.2 versions of activity/client/worker/workflow packages causes a protobuf error that prevents the Temporal Worker from running. The root cause is version misalignment of the @temporalio/proto dependency.

issues.title: core-2.2.0.tgz: 4 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 8.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Mend security vulnerability report for 4 transitive dependencies in the TypeScript SDK documentation package, including high-severity prototype pollution in json5 and RCE vulnerability in eta template engine. Issue was automatically closed after vulnerabilities were resolved or marked as ignored.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add built-in support for context propagators
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add built-in support for context propagators to simplify trace propagation across services, similar to Java and Go SDKs. Currently requires implementing with interceptors, but demand exists for a dedicated context propagation API.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add worker option to delay sending cancellation to activities on shutdown
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to align TypeScript SDK's shutdown grace period behavior with Go/Python SDKs. The TS SDK's shutdown grace period currently measures time after activities are cancelled, but should also support measuring time between shutdown request and sending cancellation to activities.

issues.title: [Bug] replay workflow with log interceptor not showing logs
issues.author: Irvenae
issues.summary: Logs are not emitted when replaying workflows that use interceptors in the TypeScript SDK. Users need to be able to see logs during workflow replay for debugging purposes.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.5.2.tgz: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency security vulnerability in nyc-test-coverage package due to transitive dependency on loader-utils 1.4.0. Two high-severity vulnerabilities (prototype pollution with CVSS 9.8 and ReDoS with CVSS 7.5) were identified in the loader-utils library used by istanbul-instrumenter-loader.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.5.1.tgz: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Two transitive dependency vulnerabilities in loader-utils (CVE-2022-37601 and CVE-2022-37603) with CVSS scores of 9.8 and 7.5 respectively affecting the nyc-test-coverage package. Both vulnerabilities lack direct remediation as the affected transitive dependency cannot be upgraded.

issues.title: ava-3.15.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.3)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in ava testing framework where got library (v9.6.0) allows redirect to UNIX socket (CVE-2022-33987). Resolved by upgrading to ava 4.0.0 which includes got 12.1.0+.

issues.title: [Bug] Module '"@temporalio/workflow"' has no exported member 'proxyActivities'.
issues.author: irohitb
issues.summary: Import statement for 'proxyActivities' from '@temporalio/workflow' fails with a module export error. User is attempting to import a function that appears to be either missing or exported under a different name in the TypeScript SDK version 0.17.1.

issues.title: Incompatible with allowSyntheticDefaultImports set to false
issues.author: neelance
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK requires allowSyntheticDefaultImports and esModuleInterop flags enabled, causing compilation errors in projects with these flags disabled. This incompatibility extends to the @temporalio/testing package which still uses default imports from CommonJS modules.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support usage of class `URL` inside workflow sandbox
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Request to expose the WHATWG URL API class in the workflow sandbox to enable URL parsing, validation, and manipulation without breaking workflow determinism. Currently users must delegate this to activities or use polyfills.

issues.title: [Doc] Document how to bundle with esbuild
issues.author: wenerme
issues.summary: User seeks documentation on how to bundle Temporal TypeScript workflows with esbuild instead of webpack, which offers significantly faster bundling but encounters issues with `__temporal_*` pseudo-modules that the SDK uses internally.

issues.title: [Bug] `WorkflowNotFoundError` used when namespace not found
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: WorkflowNotFoundError is incorrectly thrown when a namespace is not found. The error should either include namespace-not-found as a reason, create a new NamespaceNotFoundError, or be replaced with a ServiceError to accurately reflect the actual error condition.

issues.title: [Bug] Activity schedule to start metric incorrect during retries
issues.author: ksapchuk
issues.summary: The activity schedule-to-start latency metric incorrectly reports high values during retries because it uses the original activity scheduled time instead of the current attempt's scheduled time.

issues.title: Run `cargo fmt/clippy` from `npm run format/lint`
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Rust code in the core-bridge package should be formatted and linted using cargo fmt and cargo clippy as part of the npm run format and lint scripts to ensure these tools are regularly applied.

issues.title: Context deadline exceeded on test `schedules > Can update schedule action`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Test 'Can update schedule action' fails with 'context deadline exceeded' error during ScheduleClient.describe() call. The gRPC deadline is being exceeded when updating schedule actions in the TypeScript SDK test suite.

issues.title: Go through all deprecated imports
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Review all deprecated imports in the TypeScript SDK to determine if alternatives are available or needed. The issue involves enabling ESLint rules to identify deprecated imports and assessing whether to update or remove them.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow creating patches before the workflow has started
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to allow creating patches before the workflow has started. Currently the sandbox approach applies patch notifications before user code is evaluated, but this restriction could be removed with the current architecture.

issues.title: [Bug] Broken links and hierarchy
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Documentation pages for re-exported APIs have broken links and hierarchy sections depending on which package they're in. The TypeScript SDK documentation shows duplicate pages in search results and inconsistent rendering across different package namespaces (common, worker, client).

issues.title: [Feature Request] Improve experience of including workflow modules that have a `browser` field
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Bundlers pick up the `browser` field in module package.json files, causing issues in workflow modules since browser implementations use unsupported APIs. Request to automatically ignore the browser field or improve the experience of including such modules.

issues.title: [Bug] `connectTimeout` ignored when provisioning client connection
issues.author: zygopleural
issues.summary: The ConnectionOptions.connectionTimeout parameter is being ignored when creating a client connection, causing connections to always timeout at the default 10 seconds instead of the specified value.

issues.title: [Bug] Error is blank in `Failed to activate workflow` messages
issues.author: yolken-airplane
issues.summary: Error objects in 'Failed to activate workflow' log messages appear blank when serialized with JSON.stringify because Error properties are non-enumerable. The actual error details appear later in TRACE messages with less context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add client interceptor for `list` and `fetch_history`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add client interceptor support for the `list` operation and ensure `fetch_history` is interceptable when implemented. The `list` method was added in PR #942 but lacks interceptor capability.

issues.title: [Bug] Worker crashes with "async hook stack has become corrupted" on Workflow Task timeout
issues.author: thehellmaker
issues.summary: Worker crashes with 'async hook stack has become corrupted' error when a Workflow Task times out after 10 seconds. The issue stems from Node.js async hook corruption when using AsyncLocalStorage with vm context timeout, particularly in endless loops or code with missing awaits.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Formally validate public API modification between releases
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Feature request to formally validate public API modifications between releases using a tool in CI/CD. This would identify exported API changes and prevent accidental breaking changes in patch/minor releases and exposure of internal APIs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Create a separate "core" library for workflows that does not include bundler deps.
issues.author: psigen
issues.summary: Feature request to create a separate `@temporalio/worker-core` library that excludes bundler dependencies (webpack, @swc/core) to reduce runtime image size. Currently bundler deps are mandatory even when workflow bundling happens in a separate build step, adding ~150MB bloat to distroless images.

issues.title: [Bug] Queries targeting a nonexistent handler fail WFTs on non-legacy path
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Queries targeting nonexistent handlers fail workflow task completions on the non-legacy query path. When a query is issued as part of a workflow task (not as a legacy query), the SDK rejects the entire task instead of completing it successfully with a failed query result command.

issues.title: nyc-test-coverage-1.4.3.tgz: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency vulnerability report: nyc-test-coverage-1.4.3 contains transitive dependencies with critical security vulnerabilities (loader-utils 1.4.0 with CVE-2022-37601 CVSS 9.8 and CVE-2022-37603 CVSS 7.5). Issue was auto-closed after vulnerability was marked as ignored or removed from inventory.

issues.title: [Bug] Jest detects open handles
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Jest detects open handles from neon threadsafe functions when using TestWorkflowEnvironment and MockActivityEnvironment, preventing Jest from exiting cleanly even after teardown.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.4.3.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in loader-utils (CVE-2022-37601) with CVSS 9.8 severity due to prototype pollution in parseQuery function. Issue was automatically closed after vulnerability was removed from the dependency tree.

issues.title: [Bug] CI fails from forks
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: CI documentation job fails when run from repository forks because it requires a secret token that isn't available in fork environments. The job should be skipped when the token secret is not found.

issues.title: [Advice needed] Run temporal in meteor 2.7.3 / node 14.19.3
issues.author: getarun
issues.summary: User unable to run Temporal TypeScript SDK in Meteor 2.7.3 environment due to AsyncLocalStorage conflicts with Meteor's fiber-based architecture, causing crashes when calling Connection.connect().

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.4.2.tgz: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Two transitive dependencies in loader-utils (CVE-2022-37601 and CVE-2022-37599) were detected with a maximum CVSS severity of 9.8. The prototype pollution vulnerability in loader-utils 1.4.0 was flagged through the dependency chain and automatically resolved as part of dependency updates.

issues.title: [Bug] Docs Search Result Link 404
issues.author: ricmatsui
issues.summary: Documentation search results contain URLs with incorrect casing (e.g., lowercase class names) that return 404 errors when opened in new tabs or refreshed. The search index from Algolia has incorrect normalization for class names with mixed case.

issues.title: [Bug] CI flake: `failed to fill whole buffer`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: CI test flake where ephemeral server fails to start with 'failed to fill whole buffer' error. Appears to be an intermittent issue in Core rather than SDK code.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Emit metrics from client connection
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Client connection currently does not emit metrics, with metrics only being emitted from NativeConnection used by workers. This feature request asks for metrics emission to be extended to client connections as well.

issues.title: [Bug] `stress-tests` may time out
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Stress tests intermittently hang during execution, getting stuck at various completion points (e.g., 9940/10000 or 63/100 workflows). The issue is a duplicate of #853 and is caused by the stress test instance not being recycled properly.

issues.title: [Bug] nyc-test-coverage uses unmaintained istanbul-instrumenter-loader
issues.author: joebowbeer
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK's nyc-test-coverage package depends on unmaintained istanbul-instrumenter-loader, causing npm audit to report multiple security vulnerabilities including prototype pollution (CVE in ajv) and ReDoS issues in glob-parent.

issues.title: [Bug] Ignored shutdown signal causing stale workers during development
issues.author: ricmatsui
issues.summary: Worker processes continue running as orphaned processes after Ctrl+C interruption or ignore code changes during development, causing stale workers to persist. The issue is caused by the Runtime adding process signal listeners without registered callbacks, preventing proper signal handling.

issues.title: [Bug] `npx @temporalio/create@latest` fails in node 18.
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The `npx @temporalio/create@latest` command fails with a 'DownloadError: Premature close' error when using Node 18. The issue is related to a known problem with the npm node-tar package and is resolved by clearing the npx cache.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.4.1.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.6) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency vulnerability in ajv 5.5.2 (transitive dependency) with CVSS score 5.6 allows prototype pollution through crafted JSON schemas. Issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed or ignored.

issues.title: [Bug] TypeError: (0 , common_1.errorMessage) is not a function
issues.author: colinking
issues.summary: Installing an older version of @temporalio/worker pulls in the latest minor version of @temporalio/common due to caret (^) version constraints, causing breaking changes. Version 1.3.0 fails when @temporalio/common 1.4.0 unexports the errorMessage function.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Give more info in `Webpack finished with errors` message
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Webpack bundling errors in the TypeScript SDK worker produce an opaque error message that doesn't help users diagnose the actual problem. Request to include more detailed error information from Webpack in the error output.

issues.title: @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage-1.4.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.6) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in ajv 5.5.2 (CVE-2020-15366) affecting the nyc-test-coverage package. A specially crafted JSON schema could enable code execution through prototype pollution in Ajv's validate() function.

issues.title: Look into deprecated deps
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: TypeScript SDK has multiple deprecated npm dependencies causing warnings during installation. Includes outdated packages like source-map tools, uuid v3, request, and core-js v2 that need upgrades.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Don't warn about no activities during `Worker.runReplayHistory`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Users receive a confusing warning message when running Worker.runReplayHistory without activities registered, making them think something is wrong. The request is to suppress this warning during replay history operations since it's expected behavior.

issues.title: [Bug] workflowClient
issues.author: rachfop
issues.summary: Documentation search index was returning a deprecated `workflowClient` interface reference that led to a 404 page. The interface was replaced with `TestWorkflowEnvironment.workflowClient` but the search index hadn't been updated.

issues.title: [Bug] Duplicate identifier 'Long'
issues.author: marcoboucas
issues.summary: Version 1.3.0 of @temporalio/protos has a duplicate const declaration for 'Long' that causes build failures. This was caused by protobufjs recently adding the 'long' import, but the Temporal generation script was already compensating for its absence.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support Otel temporality config
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for OpenTelemetry (OTel) temporality configuration in the TypeScript SDK by exposing the temporality configuration from sdk-core PR #402.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Retry sticky worker unavailable
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Client doesn't retry the 'sticky worker unavailable' error from the server, but should treat it as a retryable server error like other similar errors.

issues.title: [Bug] Error on Render: `TypeError: failed to downcast any`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Error "failed to downcast any" occurs when creating a Worker without passing a required NativeConnection parameter. The error message from the Rust bridge is unclear and lacks context about what input was invalid.

issues.title: [Bug] Unable to run tests using Temporal SDK using vitest
issues.author: danielrearden
issues.summary: WebAssembly memory errors and threading issues when running Temporal SDK TypeScript tests with vitest instead of jest, causing crashes and unhandled rejections. Resolved in version 1.5.0.

issues.title: [Bug] `test-npm-init` hangs sometimes on Mac
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The test-npm-init workflow on macOS intermittently hangs during the 'Test run a workflow' step, sometimes taking over 2 hours instead of completing in ~9 seconds. The issue was closed after monitoring showed it hadn't occurred recently in tracked CI flakes.

issues.title: istanbul-instrumenter-loader-3.0.1.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.6)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency vulnerability in ajv-5.5.2 (CVE-2020-15366) transitively included via istanbul-instrumenter-loader and schema-utils. The vulnerability allows prototype pollution through carefully crafted JSON schemas, though the direct dependency has no available fix.

issues.title: temporal-sdk-core-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: CVE-2018-16875 vulnerability detected in webpki-0.22.0 transitive dependency through reqwest, causing potential CPU denial of service in X.509 certificate verification. Issue was automatically closed and reopened multiple times as the dependency was toggled in inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add lint rule that prevents Query handlers from mutating state
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Add an ESLint rule to prevent Query handlers from mutating state, which is a gap in TypeScript's enforced determinism. Multiple implementation approaches were explored but the feature was deprioritized due to complexity in handling various code patterns.

issues.title: [Bug] `instanceof WorkflowNotFoundError` not working
issues.author: omar-amal
issues.summary: The `instanceof WorkflowNotFoundError` check fails to catch the error thrown when a workflow doesn't exist. The issue is caused by multiple versions of `@temporalio/common` being installed, and the workaround is to check `err.name === 'WorkflowNotFoundError'` or import from `@temporalio/client` instead.

issues.title: [Bug] Stress tests did not complete in CI
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Stress tests failed to complete in CI with unclear cause. Investigation was blocked by infrastructure limitations but resolved after migrating to GitHub-hosted runners.
