issues.title: Unable to get @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage working in jest
issues.author: bennidhamma
issues.summary: NYC test coverage instrumentation for Jest tests is not generating coverage reports despite following the package documentation. When manually instrumented with NYC, the workflow function body is not being marked as covered even though tests execute successfully.

issues.title: Jest does not exit due to open handle in temporal
issues.author: bennidhamma
issues.summary: Jest test runner fails to exit cleanly due to an open handle in the native Temporal module, preventing proper code coverage collection with nyc. The issue occurs when registering native errors during module initialization.

issues.title: [Bug] Error running Temporal SDK inside linux docker container (might need musl target?)
issues.author: noxasaxon
issues.summary: Error running Temporal TypeScript SDK in Linux Docker containers without glibc (GNU libc). The core-bridge module fails to load because it only provides x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu binaries, not musl/Alpine-compatible versions, causing missing shared library errors.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Get workflow info / activity context in PayloadCodec
issues.author: klesniewski
issues.summary: Feature request to access workflow/activity execution metadata (workflowId, activityId, runId, etc.) within PayloadCodec for logging purposes. Currently, this context is only partially accessible during activity decoding via Context.current(), limiting the ability to correlate codec failures with specific workflow/activity executions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Catch-all signal handler
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request for a catch-all signal handler in TypeScript workflows to ensure in-order delivery of all signals regardless of type. Currently requires either a single signal type or multiple individual handlers, making it difficult to guarantee ordering across different signal types.

issues.title: [Bug] Remove `@types/long` stub types definition from `@temporalio/client`
issues.author: mcmxcdev
issues.summary: The @types/long stub types definition is unnecessarily listed as a dependency in @temporalio/client's package.json. Since long v5 includes its own types, this @types package should be removed from dependencies and moved to devDependencies if needed.

issues.title: [Bug] CancellationScopes (AsyncLocalStorage) scope leak with node.js 18
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: AsyncLocalStorage-based CancellationScopes may leak scope state in Node.js 18, potentially affecting code that uses condition() with timeouts which internally create and cancel scopes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add meta client
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add a meta client to the TypeScript SDK, as described in the Schedules proposal for higher-level client functionality.

issues.title: [Bug] @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage npm module doesn't contain lib
issues.author: vkarpov15
issues.summary: The @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage npm package version 1.1.0 only contains the src directory but is missing the compiled lib directory, making it unusable when installed via npm.

issues.title: [Bug] Default `WorkerOptions.maxCachedWorkflows` is too low
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The default `WorkerOptions.maxCachedWorkflows` value was significantly reduced in a recent change, causing a substantial decrease in workflow cache capacity (e.g., from 12600 to 761 on 64GB machines). The default needs to be increased to be more reasonable for typical deployments.

issues.title: [Bug] test-npm-init rate limited in CI
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: CI test-npm-init job is rate limited when downloading from api.github.com. The issue persists despite a previous PR attempt to fix it. Suggested solution is to use a Cloudflare CDN in front of api.github.com for both package creation and testing.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Remove `sourceMap` and `sourceMapPath`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Remove deprecated `sourceMap` and `sourceMapPath` configuration options that were made irrelevant by PR #819 and formally deprecated in PR #827.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Remove Long from client
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to remove the Long type from the TypeScript client SDK. The feature was originally implemented in PR #818 but was subsequently reverted in PR #827, indicating it should be removed from the codebase.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Throw when `heartbeat()` is called from Local Activities
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to throw an error when heartbeat() is called from Local Activities, aligning with Python SDK behavior. This would signal to users that heartbeats are unnecessary and ignored in local activities.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add more `console.*` functions to Workflow vm
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Users encountered TypeError when using console.warn() in workflows. Request to add missing console methods (warn, error, info, debug) to the workflow VM, which currently only supports console.log().

issues.title: [Bug] CI flake: ERR_SCRIPT_EXECUTION_TIMEOUT
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: CI test suite experiences intermittent timeouts during script execution with ERR_SCRIPT_EXECUTION_TIMEOUT errors. The issue was partially mitigated by increasing isolateExecutionTimeout from 100ms to 400ms, but rare flakes still occur under resource constraints.

issues.title: [Bug] nodeModulesPath is still used in the docs, it seems to have been removed
issues.author: ErlanBelekov
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK docs reference a deprecated `nodeModulesPaths` option that was removed from WorkerOptions, causing type errors when developers follow the documentation. The option is no longer needed as the SDK now automatically detects node_modules correctly.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Upsert TemporalChangeVersion on patch
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to upsert TemporalChangeVersion on patch updates. This feature was implemented in PR #1072 with the latest Core and requires server version 1.20 or later to take effect.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Less boiler plate.
issues.author: izakfilmalter
issues.summary: User requests significant API simplification and less boilerplate for workflow and activity setup, comparing current experience to React class components and requesting more functional patterns with colocated definitions and default options.

issues.title: Improve test server download resilience
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Test server download breaks when Java releases are broken or missing assets, affecting users' automated testing and npm installation. The issue discusses coupling to a fixed working version, fallback logic, or CDN-based distribution.

issues.title: [Bug] Issue with Long dependency being listed as devDependency
issues.author: brianlu-scale
issues.summary: The `long` package is incorrectly listed as a devDependency instead of a dependency in the TypeScript SDK, causing worker failures in production Docker containers that only install production dependencies with `yarn workspaces focus --production`.

issues.title: [Bug] Stress test: namespace not found
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Stress tests intermittently fail when a dynamically created namespace becomes unavailable before tests complete, causing TonicError with 'Namespace not found' message. The issue appears to be a race condition during namespace initialization or availability.

issues.title: [Bug] Stress test exits
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Stress test CI workflow exits with timeout error (exit code 124). The worker fails to pick up new tasks, possibly related to Docker Compose setup or artifact loss during reruns.

issues.title: [Bug] Nightly tests are broken
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Nightly tests were failing because no workflow tasks were being returned to the worker, with the logs full of poll timeout messages. The issue resolved itself without clear explanation of what changed.

issues.title: docusaurus-plugin-snipsync-1.0.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.9) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in node-fetch (CVE-2022-2596) with CVSS score 5.9 affecting the documentation build process through docusaurus-plugin-snipsync. The vulnerability is a denial of service issue in node-fetch prior to version 3.2.10.

issues.title: [Bug] Panic on nondeterministic replay
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: A panic occurs in the Neon bridge when a workflow fails nondeterministic replay validation. The error manifests as a Rust panic about improper Root handle cleanup followed by a channel closed error, preventing proper error handling.

issues.title: [Bug] Node.js fatal error on signalWithStart
issues.author: jhecking
issues.summary: Node.js fatal error occurs when signalWithStart is used to create a new workflow and send a signal to it. The worker crashes with a V8 internal check failure. The root cause was identified as a missing await on the sleep promise in the workflow code.

issues.title: Add WorkflowInfo.unsafe.now()
issues.author: albertyfwu
issues.summary: Queries that use Date.now() are calculated once and cached rather than recalculated on each query invocation, causing issues like returning stale time values for timers. The request is to add WorkflowInfo.unsafe.now() to access the current workflow time for query handlers.

issues.title: [Bug] Breakpoints do not work for workflow code
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Breakpoints cannot be set on workflow code due to bundling, making debugging impossible. The proposed solution is to run an HTTP server in debug mode to serve source maps so the debugger can map back to original source.

issues.title: [Feature Request] ScheduleClient
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to implement a ScheduleClient API for the TypeScript SDK, following the feature specification defined in the SDK features repository.

issues.title: Better Documentation for bundleWorkflowCode in Typescript SDK
issues.author: alex766
issues.summary: Documentation for bundleWorkflowCode is insufficient, lacking guidance on passing interceptors through the function to prevent non-determinism errors when replaying workflows. Users are unclear how to pass the bundled code to Worker.create.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Upgrade to protobufjs@7
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK currently depends on protobufjs@6 while the latest proto3-json-serializer requires protobufjs@7, causing users to have both versions installed. This feature request proposes upgrading to protobufjs@7 to resolve the dependency conflict.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Better Nx support
issues.author: badyan
issues.summary: User requests better support for using the Temporal TypeScript SDK within Nx monorepos, including a dedicated executor or working sample configuration to simplify bundling and command execution.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Put test server behind CDN to avoid `rate limit exceeded`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Test server downloads are rate-limited when fetching directly from GitHub. The solution is to serve test server binaries through a CDN to avoid GitHub's rate limiting.

issues.title: [Bug] Span ended twice in TypeScript SDK
issues.author: thegedge
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry spans are being ended twice in the TypeScript SDK worker, causing error messages about attempting to end an already-ended span. The issue occurs because the `instrument` function already ends the span, but an additional `.end()` call is made in the worker code.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Include string enums in failure objects
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to include string representations of enums in failure objects for better debuggability. Currently, enum values appear as numbers (e.g., `retryState: 4`), making it difficult for users to understand what the values mean.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose internal-non-workflow-common functionality
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to expose internal-non-workflow-common functionality to users, either by adding it to the API reference or restructuring internal packages to provide a non-workflow public entry point.

issues.title: Allow for Batched Replays
issues.author: alex766
issues.summary: User requests batched replay functionality to replay multiple workflows in parallel, which would improve test performance by allowing concurrent worker initialization instead of sequential replays.

issues.title: Enable import/no-deprecated
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Enable the ESLint `import/no-deprecated` rule to catch usage of deprecated APIs. The rule was added but commented out due to many RxJS deprecation warnings. After dependency pruning, determine if it's now feasible to enable.

issues.title: [Bug] payloadToJSON from from @temporalio/common/lib/proto-utils does not generate vaild proto JSON
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The payloadToJSON function from @temporalio/common/lib/proto-utils does not properly encode metadata fields as base64 strings, failing to generate valid proto JSON. The issue stems from proto3-json-serializer's inability to properly handle maps of bytes.

issues.title: [Bug] Timeout on last runReplayHistory
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: User experiencing timeout on the last workflow during runReplayHistory when replaying multiple workflows in parallel using Promise.all(). The final replay fails with 'Timed out waiting for task result' error while others succeed.

issues.title: Remove terser
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Remove terser dependency from worker package.json once webpack is updated to a version that no longer requires it as a separate dependency.

issues.title: [Bug] worker client OOM when running as a container in a k8s cluster.
issues.author: Vincechen611
issues.summary: Worker client experiences OOM errors in Kubernetes containers because maxCachedWorkflows is calculated using os.totalmem() which returns host machine memory instead of container resource limits. Recommendation to use v8.getHeapStatistics().total_available_size instead for accurate memory calculation.

issues.title: worker-1.0.0-rc.1.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.3)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: A regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) vulnerability was detected in terser 5.14.1, a transitive dependency used via webpack for build tooling. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 5.3 and is fixed in terser versions 4.8.1 and 5.14.2 or later.

issues.title: [Bug] workflowBundle with code/sourceMap breaks with obscure error, while using codePath/sourceMapPath works
issues.author: davidtheclark
issues.summary: Worker crashes with 'Invalid regular expression flags' error when using workflowBundle with inline code and sourceMap properties instead of codePath and sourceMapPath. The user was passing file paths instead of actual code content to the code property.

issues.title: [Bug] Support patched API inside condition.
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: The `patched()` API doesn't work correctly inside `condition()` calls because the patch ID is cached and returns the same value on subsequent evaluations. Users need to support updating workflow conditions after deployment without manually creating unique patch IDs for each call.

issues.title: [Bug] with yarn pnp, there are issues running workflow tests
issues.author: albertyfwu
issues.summary: Yarn PnP (Plug'n'Play) package manager breaks workflow tests in TypeScript SDK due to ESM module resolution issues and missing pnpapi dependency. The testing framework fails with VM module errors and require stack issues when using yarn workspaces.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add friendly version of listWorkflowExecutions
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add a user-friendly `listWorkflows()` method to the workflow client that simplifies pagination and provides type-safe query filtering, replacing the lower-level protobuf-based `listWorkflowExecutions` API.

issues.title: [Bug] Flaky test framework segfaults when used with Jest runner
issues.author: Irvenae
issues.summary: The test framework causes segmentation faults when run with Jest on macOS M1, though it works consistently with Mocha. The issue appears related to Jest's handling of the SDK rather than the test server itself.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `ApplicationFailure.create`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Add a static `create` method to `ApplicationFailure` for convenient instantiation with message, type, nonRetryable flag, and cause parameters.

issues.title: core-2.0.0-beta.21.tgz: 8 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Security advisory for 8 vulnerabilities (CVSS up to 9.8) detected in transitive dependencies of the documentation package, including high-severity prototype pollution and ReDoS issues in minimist, terser, and other libraries. Issue was auto-closed after marking as ignored in Mend inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `ChildWorkflowHandle.cancel()`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add a convenient `cancel()` method directly on `ChildWorkflowHandle` for canceling child workflows, instead of requiring users to cancel a scope or use external workflow handles.

issues.title: [Docs] Rank functions higher in search
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Search results on the TypeScript SDK documentation site do not rank function/method API pages highly enough. When searching for specific functions like 'continueAsNew' or 'heartbeat', the relevant API documentation pages appear near the end of results instead of at the top.

issues.title: client-1.0.0-rc.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Prototype Pollution vulnerability (CVE-2022-25878) in protobufjs 6.11.2 dependency with CVSS 7.5 severity. Vulnerability allows attackers to modify Object.prototype properties through untrusted input or .proto file parsing.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow ability to track workflow/activity input with open telemetry spans
issues.author: meg2208
issues.summary: Feature request to enhance OpenTelemetry span instrumentation to include workflow and activity inputs/outputs as span attributes for better observability and analysis in tools like Datadog.

issues.title: [Bug] Nondeterminism error: Local activity machine can't handle TimerStarted
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Local activity machine throws a nondeterminism error when a TimerStarted event occurs, preventing workflows from properly handling timer operations with local activities and condition checks.

issues.title: [Docs] Make method overloads more obvious in docs
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Documentation doesn't clearly indicate when TypeScript SDK methods have multiple overloads. Users struggle to discover alternative function signatures because overloads aren't visually distinguished or listed together.

issues.title: [Bug] Missing code coverage in TestWorkflowEnvironment
issues.author: joebowbeer
issues.summary: Code coverage reports show all workflow lines as uncovered in TestWorkflowEnvironment even though tests do execute signals and queries. This is due to workflow code executing in a sandbox environment which makes coverage tracking difficult.

issues.title: [Bug] jest times-out on first run of TestWorkflowEnvironment
issues.author: joebowbeer
issues.summary: Jest times out on the first run of TestWorkflowEnvironment in the TypeScript SDK, but subsequent runs pass. The issue appears to be a race condition or initialization delay in the test framework rather than a fundamental bug.

issues.title: [Bug] Deprecate `temporalio` meta package
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The `temporalio` meta package doesn't work with strict dependency resolution package managers like pnpm and yarn3. The team decided to deprecate it and recommend installing individual packages (@temporalio/client, @temporalio/worker, @temporalio/workflow, @temporalio/activity, @temporalio/common) directly instead.

issues.title: [Bug] Update SDK README to match 1.0.0 capabilities
issues.author: yoDon
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK README is outdated and doesn't accurately reflect the current 1.0.0 capabilities. For example, it incorrectly states that Upsert on search attributes is not implemented when it actually is supported.

issues.title: [Feature Request] `WorkflowNotFoundError` export is not consistent with `WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError`
issues.author: miroslavLalev
issues.summary: WorkflowNotFoundError is currently exported from an internal module (@temporalio/internal-workflow-common) while other common errors like WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError are exported from @temporalio/client. The request is to re-export WorkflowNotFoundError from @temporalio/client for API consistency.

issues.title: [Bug] @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry package.json refers to non-existent file
issues.author: esuh-descript
issues.summary: The @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry package.json references non-existent entry points (lib/index.js and lib/index.d.ts), causing import failures. Users must import from specific subpaths like lib/worker instead.

issues.title: got-10.7.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.3) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency security vulnerability in got-10.7.0 library (CVE-2022-33987) that allows redirects to UNIX sockets. The issue was automatically resolved by Mend when the vulnerable library was removed from the project inventory.

issues.title: got-12.0.3.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.3) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Dependency vulnerability in got 12.0.3 package (CVE-2022-33987) allowing redirect to UNIX socket. This medium severity issue was automatically resolved by removing the vulnerable library from the project inventory.

issues.title: @temporalio/client-1.0.0-rc.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Prototype Pollution vulnerability (CVE-2022-25878) in protobufjs 6.11.2 transitive dependency of @temporalio/client-1.0.0-rc.0 with CVSS score 7.5. The issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable library was removed from the Mend inventory.

issues.title: Documentation for config option `maxCachedWorkflows` references unknown option `maxIsolateMemoryMB`
issues.author: kheyse-werk
issues.summary: Documentation for the `maxCachedWorkflows` config option incorrectly references a non-existent option `maxIsolateMemoryMB`, creating a broken link in the API documentation.

issues.title: [Bug] Move native connection fields to worker
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Move NativeConnectionOptions fields (identity and workerBinaryId) from connection-level to worker-level configuration. This requires coordination with Core-side changes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `WorkflowInfo.historySizeInBytes`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add WorkflowInfo.historySizeInBytes property to the TypeScript SDK. This allows workflows to access the size of their execution history, which was blocked pending server support.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `WorkflowInfo.runStartTime`
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Add WorkflowInfo.runStartTime property to TypeScript SDK to match functionality available in Go and Java SDKs. This provides access to the workflow run start timestamp.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Cache Rust deps in CI
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to implement Rust dependency caching in CI using the rust-cache GitHub Action to improve build times by reducing redundant dependency compilation across builds.

issues.title: [Bug] Installing v0.23 I get error "Cannot find module '@temporalio/common/lib/converter/wrapped-payload-converter'"
issues.author: davidtheclark
issues.summary: Module import error in v0.23 where @temporalio/workflow imports from @temporalio/common but @temporalio/common is not declared as a dependency in workflow/package.json, causing 'Cannot find module' errors during builds.

issues.title: [Bug] TypeScript: When workflow code imports built-in Node modules, worker logs the problem instead of loudly failing
issues.author: davidtheclark
issues.summary: Worker logs a warning when workflow code imports built-in Node modules instead of failing loudly, making it difficult to detect and debug determinism violations. The issue should fail fast rather than silently continuing.

issues.title: [Bug] Node client does not send the client-name and client-version HTTP headers
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The TypeScript SDK client connection does not send client-name and client-version HTTP headers, unlike the worker connection. This header information is needed for proper client identification and tracking.

issues.title: client-0.23.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Prototype Pollution vulnerability (CVE-2022-25878) in protobufjs 6.11.2, a transitive dependency of the TypeScript SDK client. The vulnerability allows attackers to modify Object.prototype through untrusted input or .proto file parsing.

issues.title: protobufjs-6.11.2.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5)
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: protobufjs dependency version 6.11.2 contains CVE-2022-25878, a prototype pollution vulnerability with CVSS 7.5. The TypeScript SDK shipped with this vulnerable version, but the SDK's usage patterns mitigate the actual risk since it doesn't accept untrusted user input to the affected functions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide WorkflowInfo.initiator?
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to expose the Initiator enum through WorkflowInfo, allowing workflows to determine whether execution was triggered by retry, continue-as-new, cron, or other mechanisms.

issues.title: [Bug] Update isReplaying in main thread
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The isReplaying flag needs to be updated to reflect the current execution context in the main thread during workflow replay. This is a follow-up to PR #657 addressing how replay state is communicated.

issues.title: neon-0.8.3.crate: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Neon 0.8.3 dependency has a use-after-free vulnerability (CVE WS-2022-0133) with CVSS score 7.8. The issue was automatically closed as the vulnerability was either ignored or removed from the Mend inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow for easy mocking
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Users find it difficult to mock SDK functions in tests. Current mocking approaches (Jest, Sinon) don't work well with the SDK's export structure, and testing workflows requires setting up a full Worker and test client, which is cumbersome for unit testing.

issues.title: [Bug] Cannot create a new workflow with same workflowId of a completed one
issues.author: ThePinger
issues.summary: User encountered a WorkflowNotFoundError when attempting to create a new workflow with the same workflowId as a completed one, even after specifying ALLOW_DUPLICATE policy. The error was ultimately traced to signal() calls rather than workflow creation.

issues.title: [Bug] instanceof doesn't work with WorkflowInfo fields
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: instanceof checks fail on WorkflowInfo fields because the info object is created outside the VM context, causing type checks like `searchAttributes.CustomIntField instanceof Array` to return false.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Validate retry policy `maxAttempts` is an integer (e.g. not `Infinity`)
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to add validation for retry policy `maxAttempts` parameter to ensure it's an integer and not `Infinity` or other invalid values.

issues.title: [Bug] ActivityInterface adds a string index to any interface that implements it
issues.author: beaucollins
issues.summary: ActivityInterface adds a string index signature to any interface that extends it, allowing TypeScript to accept any method call on proxy objects without type checking. This creates a mismatch between compile-time and runtime behavior where invalid method calls compile but fail at runtime.

issues.title: Memory leak on the temporal worker side
issues.author: viavdeyenk-mts
issues.summary: Memory leak caused by accumulation of OperatorSubscriber objects that are not properly cleaned up in the temporal TypeScript worker, leading to out-of-memory container kills. Issue was resolved in an earlier SDK version, though similar symptoms may occur in user code with incorrect AsyncLocalStorage cleanup.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make docs breadcrumbs clickable
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to make documentation breadcrumbs clickable for easier navigation. Currently only the house emoji icon is clickable, but other breadcrumb elements should be interactive.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose grpc static headers in NativeConnection
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Expose gRPC static headers support in NativeConnection to match core client capabilities. This feature is already implemented in the core client but needs to be exposed through the NativeConnection API and integrated in the bridge.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Disable up-to-date PRs requirement
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to disable GitHub's "require branches to be up to date before merging" requirement for faster PR merging. Currently, every time a PR is merged, all other PRs are blocked and require manual updating and rerunning of checks.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix non-TemporalFailure type
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The failure type for non-TemporalFailure exceptions is incorrectly set to 'Error' instead of the actual exception class name. When throwing a custom error that extends Error (but not TemporalFailure), the type should reflect the actual class name like 'MyFailure' rather than the parent 'Error' class.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix message when objects are thrown
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: When non-Error objects are thrown in workflows (e.g., `throw {a: 'test'}`), the error message shows `[object Object]` instead of the serialized object value. The issue involves proper serialization and safe handling of non-Error values thrown from user code.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support loading history from tctl / web JSON exports in replayer
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to support loading workflow execution history from tctl/web JSON exports in the replayer by leveraging proto JSON serialization with json-module output.

issues.title: [Bug] OpenTelemetry interceptors patch global runtime outside workflow isolate too
issues.author: airhorns
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry interceptors package modifies the global object to add a `window` property when imported, affecting code outside the workflow isolate that depends on `typeof window === "undefined"` checks. This breaks existing Node.js projects that use this common pattern to detect browser vs server environments.

issues.title: We have a regression in our tests where we can no longer run tests from forks:
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Tests cannot run from GitHub forks due to a regression in the test infrastructure. This breaks CI/CD pipelines for external contributors.

issues.title: [Bug] `ShutdownError: Core is shut down` error when running in jest
issues.author: airhorns
issues.summary: Jest test isolation causes `ShutdownError: Core is shut down` errors when running multiple Temporal test files simultaneously in the same process. The root cause is module duplication where different test files get separate copies of the errors module, causing incompatibility issues.

issues.title: [Bug] Heap out of memory on `setHandler(signal, undefined)`
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Calling `setHandler(signal, undefined)` to clear a signal handler while buffered signals exist causes a heap out of memory crash. The bug occurs because `setHandler` iterates over buffered signals and re-processes them, but when the handler is undefined, they get pushed back into the same buffer being iterated, creating an infinite loop.

issues.title: [Bug] Sink API appears to create circular JSON
issues.author: alex-dixon
issues.summary: Sink API creates circular JSON structures when passing data between workflow and sink threads via postMessage, causing JSON.stringify() to fail with circular reference error on the receiving end.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Better balancing of workflows between worker threads
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Worker threads in the TypeScript SDK use round-robin dispatch for workflows, which can lead to unbalanced load distribution. Implementing a least-loaded worker selection strategy would improve thread utilization and overall system balance.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Eager Connection with `getSystemInfo`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Update TypeScript SDK Connection to eagerly connect with getSystemInfo RPC call. Make Connection constructor private and add async Connection.create() factory method. Update WorkflowClient to require a Connection instance and add WorkflowClient.forLocalHost() helper.

issues.title: [Bug] Test env tests fail on windows
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Test environment tests fail intermittently on Windows with Node 14, causing CI failures during test execution. The issue appears to be environment-specific flakiness rather than a fundamental bug.

issues.title: [Bug] Runtime logger isn't used by webpack bundler
issues.author: airhorns
issues.summary: Custom logger passed to Runtime.install() wasn't being used by webpack for build-time logging. Webpack logs were emitted via console.error instead of flowing through the configured logger entry function.

issues.title: core-2.0.0-beta.18.tgz: 9 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Automated security vulnerability scan detected 9 vulnerabilities in transitive dependencies of the core package beta 18, with the highest severity being 7.8 (CVE-2021-43138 in async library). The issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable dependencies were removed from the inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Assert single version of `@temporalio/workflow` is loaded into the workflow runtime
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to ensure only a single version of @temporalio/workflow is loaded into the workflow runtime. Multiple library versions cause failures because workflow state is stored in module static variables.

issues.title: [Feature Request] codec -> codecs
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to rename the 'codec' configuration option to 'codecs' in the TypeScript SDK for consistency and clarity.

issues.title: Upsertsearchattributes
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to add UpsertSearchAttributes functionality to the TypeScript SDK for updating search attributes on running workflows.

issues.title: swc-loader-0.1.15.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency minimist-1.2.5 has critical prototype pollution vulnerability (CVE-2021-44906) with CVSS 9.8 score. The vulnerability exists in swc-loader via loader-utils and json5 dependencies.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Change nonRetryable constructor param
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to rename the `nonRetryable` boolean parameter to `retryable` with inverted default in SDK constructors for improved code readability. The request was rejected due to backwards compatibility concerns.

issues.title: [Bug] Parent workflow doesn't fail when child workflow encounters WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError
issues.author: dutabado
issues.summary: Parent workflow remains stuck in Running state when child workflow fails with WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError, preventing the parent from exiting even after child completes and is restarted.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add more detailed error/stack to TransportError errors
issues.author: rcarton
issues.summary: TransportError exceptions lack detailed error information and stack traces, making it difficult to troubleshoot connection issues to Temporal clusters. Users need better diagnostics to identify root causes like missing CA certificates, incorrect server addresses, or missing/invalid TLS certificates.

issues.title: [Bug] Process exits when calling client.start or client.execute
issues.author: danielrearden
issues.summary: Client process exits with status 0 when calling start() or execute() with an unresolvable DNS address, instead of rejecting the promise with an error.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Return string for Workflow status
issues.author: rupalivohra
issues.summary: Feature request to return workflow status as a human-readable string instead of a gRPC enum number in WorkflowExecutionDescription. Currently users must build wrappers to translate numeric status codes to meaningful strings.

issues.title: core-2.0.0-beta.15.tgz: 8 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Automated security report identifying 8 vulnerabilities in transitive dependencies of the core package, with the highest severity being 7.8 (CVE-2021-43138 in async library). The issue was automatically closed when the vulnerable dependencies were removed or updated.

issues.title: temporal-client-0.1.0: 3 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Three transitive dependencies in the Rust core-bridge package contain security vulnerabilities (2 high severity DoS issues in rustls-webpki and 1 medium severity memory issue in rustix). This is an automated security alert that was repeatedly opened and closed as dependencies were updated.

issues.title: json5-2.2.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in json5 package exposes minimist-1.2.5 with CVE-2021-44906, a prototype pollution vulnerability with CVSS score of 9.8. The vulnerability was automatically closed after the library was removed from the dependency inventory.

issues.title: typedoc-0.21.6.tgz: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: TypeDoc 0.21.6 contains transitive vulnerability in marked library (CVE-2022-21681 and CVE-2022-21680) with CVSS score of 7.5, causing potential ReDoS attacks through malicious markdown input.

issues.title: webpack-5.5.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in css-what (CVE-2021-33587) with CVSS 7.5 severity affecting webpack build. The vulnerability allows ReDoS attacks through malformed CSS selectors with quadratic time complexity.

issues.title: lerna-4.0.0.tgz: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in qs 6.5.3 (CVE-2021-44907) via lerna causes a Denial of Service risk due to insufficient property sanitization in query parsing. The issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from inventory.

issues.title: [Bug] Heartbeat details should be array?
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Activity.heartbeat() in TypeScript SDK takes a single parameter but should accept an array of Payloads to match the Core SDK specification and be consistent with Go's varargs implementation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use options object for ApplicationFailure
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to improve ApplicationFailure API by using an options object instead of positional parameters. The proposal suggests making the constructor accept a configuration object with optional message, type, retryable (instead of nonRetryable), and cause fields, along with a static helper method for creating non-retryable failures.

issues.title: [Docs] Versionize documentation
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to versionize documentation and API reference for the TypeScript SDK so that users can access documentation matching their installed version, rather than always seeing the latest development version.

issues.title: [Bug] WithWorkflowArgs is not exported
issues.author: rupalivohra
issues.summary: WithWorkflowArgs type was removed from @temporalio/common and is not exported from @temporalio/client, breaking code that relies on this type for strong typing in SignalWithStart client calls.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Move BuildKite builds to GH Actions
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Move CI/CD builds from BuildKite to GitHub Actions for better public visibility and to work around a BuildKite docker-compose plugin bug affecting nightly jobs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Remote codec converter
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to implement a remote codec converter for TypeScript SDK, equivalent to the Go SDK's NewRemoteDataConverter functionality for encoding/decoding workflow data.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Error when Workflow APIs are used outside of vm
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Users get confusing error messages when using Workflow APIs (like condition or sleep) outside of the workflow VM context, such as in Activities. The error messages don't clearly indicate the underlying problem, causing confusion about what's wrong.

issues.title: [Bug] Windows test exists with code 1 without failures
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Windows test suite intermittently exits with code 1 despite all tests passing, with missing test output suggesting a test timeout or pending test issue on that platform.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use protobufjs global for deserializing protobufs
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to simplify protobuf payload converter usage by leveraging protobufjs's global module.roots field instead of requiring users to pass a root argument. This would reduce configuration complexity but requires compatible package manager setup and duplicate message name handling.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix snipsync
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Snip comments are not displaying correctly in the generated API documentation, preventing documentation snippets from appearing as expected in the docusaurus-generated API docs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Require a Worker to specify either workflowsPath or workflowBundle
issues.author: ksapchuk
issues.summary: Worker starts successfully without any workflows or activities configured, making it difficult to debug. Request to either require at least one workflow/activity/workflowsPath option at type level or add warning logging.

issues.title: [Feature Request] After `create`, give customized setup instructions
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to make the `create` command's post-installation instructions more intelligent by detecting the platform and checking if dependencies like docker-compose, Temporal Server, and Node.js are already installed before displaying setup instructions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reduce size of aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu binary release is 228 MB, significantly larger than other platform builds. The issue was resolved by automating the build process for this target in GitHub Actions instead of building on macOS.

issues.title: Test last heartbeat details shows up on Activity retry
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Add a test for the TypeScript SDK that verifies heartbeat details are preserved across activity retries, similar to the existing Python test that checks heartbeat details are correctly carried forward through multiple retry attempts.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow webpack configuration
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to allow customization of the webpack configuration used for bundling Temporal workflows in the TypeScript SDK. Users need flexibility to apply webpack plugins, overrides, and custom configurations for various use cases.

issues.title: [Bug] regenerator-runtime not found
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: When using ts-node with swc-loader, the bundler sometimes includes regenerator-runtime in the webpack bundle even though it's not needed for Node 14+ target, causing module resolution failures. The issue was resolved by including swc-loader in the SDK.

issues.title: [Bug] test-npm-init hangs
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The test-npm-init test hangs during the 'Test run a workflow' step with no output, causing CI failures. The issue was resolved by PR #535.

issues.title: [Bug] test-worker-no-workflows intermittent failure
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The test-worker-no-workflows test intermittently fails with a GracefulShutdownPeriodExpiredError timeout while waiting for the worker to shut down gracefully, occurring some of the time during integration test runs.

issues.title: [Bug] CI tests skipped due to an issue with core build?
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: CI tests are being skipped with 'No tests found' errors in the TypeScript SDK build pipeline. The issue manifests in the Windows CI environment, particularly affecting integration and codec tests.

issues.title: Activity not found and activity arg conversion errors should be retryable.
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Activity not found and activity argument conversion errors are currently marked as non-retryable in the TypeScript SDK, but should be retryable to align with behavior in other Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: [Bug] bundleWorkflowCode fails on "heavyweight" dependencies
issues.author: mjameswh
issues.summary: Webpack bundling of workflow code fails when transitive dependencies pull in Node.js built-in modules or native code. The bundler incorrectly tries to resolve these modules, causing build failures even when they're not actually used at runtime.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Run headers through codec
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to allow codec/custom data converter to process headers, particularly OpenTelemetry baggage headers, with contextual information passed to encode/decode operations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Get proto comments in API docs
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Proto comments from the Temporal API are not included in the generated TypeScript API documentation, making protobufjs-generated classes lack explanatory text for their properties. Users want proto file comments to appear in the generated TypeScript API docs.

issues.title: [Bug] Failed Activity heartbeat data conversion can crash the worker
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Failed activity heartbeat data conversion could crash the worker. The system didn't catch data conversion errors during heartbeats and should instead report them as activity cancellations to handle them gracefully.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add WorkflowExecutionAlreadyTerminated
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add WorkflowExecutionAlreadyTerminated error for handling attempts to terminate an already-terminated workflow with the same ID, similar to the existing WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix flakey tests
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Collection of transient CI test failures in the TypeScript SDK that require fixes rather than manual rebuilds. Includes failures with verdaccio registry path handling and 'channel closed' errors during replay tests.

issues.title: [Bug] CHANGELOG for 0.18.0 doesn't reflect breaking change for client error handling
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The CHANGELOG for version 0.18.0 doesn't document a breaking change in client error handling where users must now catch specific errors instead of relying on gRPC error codes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Encode baggage part of trace
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to encode baggage as part of trace context in the TypeScript SDK. User references issue #514 for additional details.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add setDefaultDataConverter
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add a setDefaultDataConverter method to the TypeScript SDK for configuring a default data converter globally.

issues.title: [Bug] `npm i --production` insufficient
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: When using `npm i --production`, the TypeScript SDK's workflow bundler fails to resolve dependencies like `ms` because webpack's module resolution doesn't include `node_modules` in its search paths, causing production builds to fail.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add all-method interceptors
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request for all-method interceptors or middleware for the TypeScript SDK client. The user wants a simplified way to intercept all communication with the client/worker, similar to Apollo Client's Network Links, particularly for centralized error handling across all methods.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add workflow.getLastCompletionResult
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to expose the last workflow completion result directly in the workflow context, similar to Go and Java SDKs. Users currently need to use an activity and client to retrieve this information.

issues.title: [Feature Request] NestJS Transport / Integration?
issues.author: StevenLangbroek
issues.summary: Request to create a NestJS integration/transport for the TypeScript SDK to enable decorator-based workflow and activity definitions following NestJS conventions. The requester explored a proof-of-concept and established design principles for supporting both monolithic and microservice architectures while avoiding non-deterministic code patterns.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Wrap `WorkflowHandle.describe` output in a JS friendly object
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: Wrap the output of WorkflowHandle.describe() in a JavaScript-friendly object instead of returning the raw gRPC response, improving usability for TypeScript/JavaScript developers.

issues.title: Tracking: spec-compliant JSON in protobuf.js
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: protobufjs's `.toJSON` method doesn't implement proto3-spec-compliant JSON encoding, causing incompatibility with other SDKs. The issue tracks whether to fix protobufjs or add alternative methods to make protobuf support easier for TypeScript SDK users.

issues.title: [Feature Request] sleepUntil and UpdatableTimer utils
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: Request for sleepUntil and UpdatableTimer utility functions to simplify common async patterns in workflows, particularly for recurring tasks like monthly operations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add equivalent to setFailWorkflowExceptionTypes
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add a Worker-level option to specify exception types that should fail the workflow instead of causing retry loops, similar to Java's setFailWorkflowExceptionTypes. The request was ultimately declined in favor of using interceptors for more flexible error handling.

issues.title: [Feature Request] eslint plugin
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to create an ESLint plugin for the TypeScript SDK to catch determinism violations and other workflow-specific issues at compile time. The plugin would enforce workflow constraints like banned Node globals, proper async handling in signal handlers, and error throwing patterns.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Log when in activity-only mode
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Worker should log an informational message when initialized with no workflows registered, to help users diagnose configuration issues where they accidentally skip workflow bundle initialization.

issues.title: [Feature Request] TerminatedFailure missing "details"
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The TerminatedFailure object is missing a 'details' field that is available on the WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes and accepted by the terminate API. This inconsistency prevents users from accessing termination details.

issues.title: [Bug] Allow registerErrors to be called multiple times
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: When registerErrors() is called multiple times on the TypeScript SDK bridge, it panics due to improper handling of the Neon Root handle. This occurs when worker code runs multiple times or in test scenarios with Jest mocking.

issues.title: [Bug] describeTaskQueue returns empty array of pollers
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The describeTaskQueue API was returning an empty pollers array because the taskQueueType parameter was not being specified in the request. Users needed to explicitly provide the task queue type to get the poller information.

issues.title: [Bug] WorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes.retry_state not respected
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: During workflow result handling, the retry_state field from WorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes is hardcoded instead of being read from the actual event attributes.

issues.title: [Bug] Put more info into workflow activation failures
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Workflow activation failures lack detailed debugging information. The error message, stack trace, and cause fields are often empty or unhelpful, making it difficult to diagnose issues thrown from workflows.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Log all errors in Worker
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Worker doesn't log errors when TemporalFailure instances are thrown in workflows, only logging standard Errors. User requests consistent error logging for all error types including ApplicationFailure and custom failures extending TemporalFailure.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix & document which errors cause Workflow Execution failure
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Documentation clarification about which error types cause WorkflowExecutionFailed vs WorkflowTaskFailed events. User was confused about when TemporalFailure and ApplicationFailure with different nonRetryable settings trigger which event types.

issues.title: [Bug] Pre-built Rust bridge does not seem to be used on Windows
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Pre-built Rust bridge binaries are not being utilized on Windows during SDK installation, causing significantly longer installation times compared to Ubuntu and macOS.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add SAGA helpers?
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to add SAGA (Saga pattern) helpers to the TypeScript SDK for consistency with Java and PHP SDKs, which already include built-in SAGA implementations.

issues.title: [Bug] serverNameOverride in tlsConfig does not have expected effect on grpc request
issues.author: jbreiding
issues.summary: The serverNameOverride configuration in tlsConfig does not properly set the gRPC authority header for SNI (Server Name Indication), unlike the Go SDK. Users must work around this by manually setting the grpc.default_authority channel argument.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add default value to workflowId
issues.author: emmanuelvlad
issues.summary: Feature request to add a default value (crypto.randomUUID()) to workflowId to reduce redundant code. Request was declined in favor of guiding users toward business-meaningful IDs instead of random IDs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support easily injecting headers into the grpc connection
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add a simplified API to inject headers into the gRPC connection without requiring users to write custom interceptors. This is a common pattern that should be easier to accomplish.

issues.title: [Bug] workflows wont launch on Windows if project folder starts with 'n'
issues.author: yoDon
issues.summary: Windows path handling bug where project directories starting with 'n' have the characters '\n' incorrectly stripped from the path, causing workflows to fail to launch. The root cause is identified as the dedent library treating backslash-n as a newline escape sequence.

issues.title: Add parent workflow information in `WorkflowInfo`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add parent workflow information to the WorkflowInfo object to enable child workflows to access details about their parent workflow context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Warn user when sending unregistered signal
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: User requests a warning when sending unregistered signals to workflows. Currently, handle.signal() succeeds silently even when the workflow has no handler for that signal, making debugging difficult. A warning message should be logged by the Worker to help users identify misspelled signals or missing handler registrations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Improve default data converter
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Users expect Date objects to be preserved when passed through Temporal workflows, but instead receive ISO strings due to JSON serialization. The feature request seeks to improve the default data converter to handle Dates and other types lost during JSON.parse.

issues.title: [Bug] Retry policy intervals get rounded down to the second
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Retry policy intervals specified in milliseconds (e.g., 500ms) are incorrectly rounded down to zero seconds when sent to the server. The SDK should round up durations like other SDKs do.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide/use default retry policy
issues.author: zomble
issues.summary: Activity retry policy was not using server-defined defaults as expected, causing workflows to fail with 'RetryPolicyNotSet' error when no explicit retry policy was provided. The issue was resolved after investigation confirmed that default policies are indeed being set correctly.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Header support for signals and queries
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for headers in signals and queries, matching the feature added to the Temporal Server. This aligns TypeScript SDK with Go and Java SDK implementations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add headers to signal and query interceptors
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Server now supports headers in signal and query requests. The TypeScript SDK needs to expose this functionality through the various interceptors to allow developers to access and manipulate these headers.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make binary the default protobuf data converter
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to make binary the default protobuf data converter instead of JSON in the TypeScript SDK, prioritizing efficiency over human readability. This change should be coordinated across all SDKs simultaneously.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Create new shared package not used by workflow
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Proto3-json-serializer dependency added to common package increases workflow bundle size from 0.75MB to 0.86MB. Create a new shared package for code and dependencies not used in workflow package to reduce bundle size.

issues.title: [Feature Request] pnpm support
issues.author: mengyazhu96
issues.summary: pnpm package manager support is needed for the TypeScript SDK. Currently webpack builds fail with pnpm due to its hoisted module structure, requiring workaround using shamefully-hoist flag. Discussion concluded that users should install @temporalio/* packages directly instead of the temporalio package.

issues.title: [Feature Request] DSL example
issues.author: viperfx
issues.summary: Request to add a TypeScript DSL workflow example to match existing examples in Go and Java SDKs. This would provide TypeScript developers with a complete reference implementation of DSL patterns.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Generic workflow defaults: T extends Workflow = Workflow
issues.author: JoshuaKGoldberg
issues.summary: Add generic default type parameter to WorkflowHandle interface to allow usage without specifying explicit workflow type. Currently requires T extends Workflow, but should support T extends Workflow = Workflow for more flexible handle creation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Export SDK version
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Need an official, documented way to export the SDK version at runtime in the TypeScript SDK. Currently version can be accessed via internal import paths or package.json, but should have a blessed public API.

issues.title: [Bug] `npx @temporalio/create` fails for some users
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The `npx @temporalio/create` command fails to execute for some users on Node 14.15.0. The issue appears to be environment-specific with limited details provided in the bug report.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update users on their Workflow Execution progress in the shell
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: User requested enhanced shell logging during workflow execution to provide visibility into workflow progress, activity execution, and failures without requiring the web console. This was addressed through logging interceptors added to the SDK.

issues.title: [Bug] Poor error message running sleep() in a Node script
issues.author: JoshuaKGoldberg
issues.summary: When calling workflow API functions like sleep() outside of a workflow context (in a Node script), the error message is cryptic ("exports.storage.getStore is not a function") instead of clearly indicating the function must be run within a workflow.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Help users avoid no-worker bug
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to help users debug the common issue of workflows not executing because no worker is polling the correct task queue. Proposes logging a helpful warning message when start/execute/signalWithStart is called and no workers are available on the specified queue.

issues.title: [Bug] ContinueAsNew shouldn't occur as error in Otel traces
issues.author: schickling
issues.summary: ContinueAsNew workflow transitions are incorrectly appearing as errors in OpenTelemetry traces, causing unnecessary noise and confusion in observability data.

issues.title: Fix broken init-from-verdaccio in node 14 and enable jobs in CI
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Node 14 and 18 support was disabled in CI for the npm init verdaccio test. This issue tracks re-enabling the broken test and adding these Node versions to the CI matrix.

issues.title: WorkerOptions.interceptors.workflowModules might not be available if workflows are pre-bundled
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Workflow interceptors require double configuration: once for bundler inclusion and again in WorkerOptions. When workflows are pre-bundled, WorkerOptions.interceptors.workflowModules may become unavailable since require.resolve might not work in the pre-bundled worker process.

issues.title: Add an integration test to verify Workflows are retried in case of multiple consecutive timeouts
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add an integration test to verify that Workflows are automatically retried when experiencing multiple consecutive timeouts. This ensures the retry behavior works correctly end-to-end in the TypeScript SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add actual span time to spans create by workflow otel interceptors
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to add actual span time to spans created by workflow OpenTelemetry interceptors. Currently, spans use workflow task time which differs from actual processing time, limiting visibility into system behavior.

issues.title: [Bug] package initalizer errors on node 14
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: Package initializer fails on Node 14 due to incorrect tsconfig version being set based on Node version. The tool was replacing the tsconfig entry in package.json with an incompatible version for older Node versions.

issues.title: [Bug] "npm install" fails on windows, msvc 2017, ...
issues.author: cons0l3
issues.summary: npm install fails on Windows with MSVC 2017 due to three cross-platform compatibility issues: non-cross-OS build script in core-bridge, OS-specific cargo artifact spawning, and isolated-vm compilation errors with Windows macro expansion.

issues.title: Improve error message: Workflow executionsRow not found
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Worker error message "Workflow executionsRow not found" is unclear and doesn't help users understand what went wrong. The message should provide higher-level context about the failure and suggest possible causes.

issues.title: Improve error message: context deadline exceeded
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: The gRPC DEADLINE_EXCEEDED error message is cryptic and doesn't help users troubleshoot. The request is to improve the error message to provide context and link to documentation about common causes and solutions.

issues.title: Improve error message: 'foo' is not a function
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Improve error messages when a Worker doesn't have the required Workflow function in its bundle. Instead of cryptic 'foo is not a function' errors, provide a helpful message that explains possible causes and links to documentation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add aarch64-unkown-linux-gnu to list of build targets for Rust Core
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add support for aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu build target for Rust Core to enable building containers on M1 Macs. The aarch64-apple-darwin target is already supported, but users need the Linux ARM64 GNU target for cross-compilation to Linux containers.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Deprecate patch for condition timer cancellation
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Remove the patch that was added for timer cancellation in condition workflows. This deprecation was a planned cleanup following the decision to not use a patch approach for this functionality.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide docker image(s) for compiling/running workers
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Feature request to provide official Docker images for building and running Temporal TypeScript workers, addressing user uncertainty about containerization practices. The request was closed as the team decided that VM support and pre-built binaries for major architectures made dedicated Docker images unnecessary.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide better errors when user passes a nameless function to infer workflow name
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Users passing nameless/anonymous functions to infer workflow names receive unhelpful error messages. The SDK should validate function names at runtime and provide better error messages when functions aren't exported or named properly.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Better context for grpc errors in client
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: gRPC errors thrown by the client lack meaningful context and have useless stack traces, making debugging difficult. The SDK should catch errors from WorkflowClient methods and rethrow them with better context about what operation failed.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Rename external dependencies to sinks
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Rename the 'external dependencies' feature to 'sinks' to better reflect its actual functionality. The current name is misleading because this mechanism cannot be used to return values into the workflow.

issues.title: [Bug] Timer is not cancelled when condition resolves
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Timer cancellation is not being properly cleaned up when a condition resolves, leading to unnecessary system load. The issue requests implementation of proper timer cancellation to reduce resource consumption.

issues.title: [Bug] Patches should be applied to workflow before workflow code is required
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: User requested support for applying patches at the top level of workflow code before the workflow function is required. The feature was later decided against due to confusion from patches at top level applying to all workflows.

issues.title: Make tracing tags consistent across SDKs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Tracing tags are inconsistent across different Temporal SDKs. This feature request asks for standardization of tracing tags across all SDKs (Go, Java, TypeScript, etc.) to ensure consistent observability across different language implementations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Improve error messages when the wrong worker is polling the queue
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to improve error messages when the wrong worker is polling the queue or when workflow functions are not found. Currently errors like 'Task not found' and 'is not a function' are cryptic; the request suggests more helpful messages that explain what went wrong and suggest possible causes.

issues.title: [Docs] Add SDK errors to code and API docs
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Request to document SDK errors in API docs and enable type-safe error handling via error classes. Users need to discover which errors methods can throw and use instanceof for error type checking instead of runtime discovery.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Expose history size to Workflow code
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to expose history event count and aggregated payload size through WorkflowInfo to help workflow authors make informed decisions about when to continue as new. Currently, developers must estimate history length using interceptors or arbitrary thresholds.

issues.title: [Bug] Algolia broken
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Algolia search integration is broken with a 403 API key error, preventing search functionality from working in the TypeScript SDK documentation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add SIGUSR2 to list of default worker shutdownSignals
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add SIGUSR2 signal to the default list of worker shutdown signals. This signal is commonly used by nodemon for graceful shutdown and should be included by default.

issues.title: [Bug] Retry worker connection when temporal server is down
issues.author: emmanuelvlad
issues.summary: Worker fails to reconnect when the Temporal server is initially down, throwing a transport error and stopping retry attempts. Unlike issue #290 which retries after server recovery, this addresses the case where the server is down when the worker starts.

issues.title: Speed up GitHub Action
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: GitHub Actions CI workflow runs slowly, causing developers to wait for feedback on pull requests. The request is to optimize the workflow through parallelization, improved caching, or dedicated infrastructure.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add built-in "getHandlers" query
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to add a built-in 'getHandlers' query method to the TypeScript SDK. This issue was closed as a duplicate of #1081, which provides more detailed discussion.

issues.title: [Bug] Package initializer does not work for some users
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: The @temporalio/create package initializer fails with ENOENT errors when cloning sample projects, as the tar extraction doesn't properly validate that the package.json exists in the cloned folder before attempting to read it.

issues.title: [Bug] Opentelemetry bugs/findings
issues.author: schickling
issues.summary: Multiple OpenTelemetry instrumentation bugs affecting span timing accuracy, service name propagation, trace hierarchy, and internal SDK traces visibility in the TypeScript SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Accept prebuilt bundles in Workers
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: Request to allow Workers to accept prebuilt bundles for improved deployment efficiency. Marked as duplicate of #310.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add statsd support to Typescript SDK
issues.author: mengyazhu96
issues.summary: Request to add statsd metrics support to TypeScript SDK to track ScheduleToStart and other metrics for production deployments using statsd and Datadog integration.

issues.title: Guidance on connection and client instantiation pattern when long-lived connections will frequently drop
issues.author: davidtheclark
issues.summary: User seeks guidance on proper client instantiation patterns when long-lived server connections frequently drop due to server redeployment. They question whether to reuse a single Connection/WorkflowClient or create new instances per request.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use single Error type for WorkflowClient errors.
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Unify WorkflowClient error handling by using a single Error type with Failure objects as causes, replacing the current approach of separate error classes for each workflow failure type.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use the newer `Context.SetPromiseHooks` API for the workflow isolate extension.
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to adopt the newer `Context.SetPromiseHooks` API for workflow isolate extensions. The new API is bound to a single context and uses faster JS functions compared to the current C++ implementation that redundantly overrides promise hooks per context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Improve workflow id documentation
issues.author: joebowbeer
issues.summary: Documentation for workflow ID generation was misleading, suggesting autogenerated IDs are suitable for most cases when business-meaningful IDs are often better. The docs needed to emphasize the importance of intentional workflow ID selection, especially for use cases like signalWithStart, and clarify the distinction between creating handles and creating new workflows.

issues.title: [Bug] undelete WeakMap and WeakSet
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: WeakMap and WeakSet were deleted from the SDK but need to be restored to support private variables in TypeScript. The issue also flags FinalizationRegistry for deletion.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add missing continuedAsNewExecutionRunId to WorkflowInfo interface
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add the missing continuedAsNewExecutionRunId field to the WorkflowInfo interface to support accessing the run ID when a workflow continues as new. The request also suggests adding parentId and parentRunId for child workflow support.

issues.title: Expose health check on WorkflowClient
issues.author: Spikhalskiy
issues.summary: Users need a health check method on WorkflowClient or WorkflowServiceStubs to verify the underlying connection to the Temporal server is healthy. This was a common request across multiple SDKs.

issues.title: [Bug] Core bridge crashes when given invalid options
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Core bridge crashes with a panic when given invalid TLS certificate options instead of throwing an informative error. This affects JavaScript users who bypass TypeScript's type protection.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support separating bundling and executing of workers
issues.author: schickling
issues.summary: Users want to separate workflow code bundling from worker execution, allowing them to use custom bundlers (like esbuild) instead of the built-in webpack bundler and trigger only code execution on startup.

issues.title: [Request] split `createWorkflowHandle` into `getExistingWorkflowHandle`?
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: The `createWorkflowHandle` function has confusing overloaded behavior for both creating new workflows and retrieving existing ones. When users accidentally pass a workflow ID string instead of an object, they get an unclear error message. Request to split this into separate `createWorkflowHandle` and `getExistingWorkflowHandle` functions for better API clarity.

issues.title: [Bug] Unhandled grpc error: BadStartTimerAttributes: A valid StartToFireTimeout is not set on command
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: Timer creation fails with "BadStartTimerAttributes" error when StartToFireTimeout is not properly set on the timer command, causing workers to crash with an unhandled gRPC error.

issues.title: [Feature Request] activity.Context.sleep args should pass through ms
issues.author: swyxio
issues.summary: The activity.Context.sleep method should accept time duration as a string (e.g., '1s', '100ms') in addition to milliseconds, similar to the existing behavior in issue #270.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Help users avoid old-worker-code bug
issues.author: lorensr
issues.summary: Feature request to warn developers when multiple worker processes are running on the same machine with potentially different code versions, which can cause non-deterministic task execution in development environments.

issues.title: [Bug] INVALID_ARGUMENT: Workflow did not register a handler for getSecret in IT
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Queries are not properly registered when interceptors are involved and multiple jobs (start workflow, signal, query) are delivered in a single activation. The issue appears to be a race condition where async interceptor functions prevent the workflow function from being invoked before query handlers are needed.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support connecting to multiple server addresses from Core and optionally the Node gRPC client
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to support connecting to multiple server addresses from the Core API and optionally the Node gRPC client, similar to the Go SDK implementation.

issues.title: Automated release to `next` tag on merge to `main`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to automatically publish to npm with the 'next' tag on merge to main branch, allowing users to test new features and fixes before official releases without waiting for a release process.

issues.title: Consider strict boolean check in `condition` function return value
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Discussion about whether the `condition` function should use strict boolean checks (=== true) instead of truthy checks. Users might expect `condition(() => array.length)` to work like an if statement, but truthy values could cause unexpected behavior.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reconnecting to the server instead of crashing
issues.author: emmanuelvlad
issues.summary: Worker crashes when Temporal server is down or goes offline, unable to reconnect. The TypeScript SDK should handle server unavailability gracefully like the Go SDK, allowing workers to be created before server is available and reconnect automatically when it comes back up.

issues.title: [Bug] workflowIdReusePolicy default should not be set by the SDK
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The SDK is explicitly setting a default value for workflowIdReusePolicy, but the server already provides a default. This causes unnecessary duplication and potential inconsistency.
